Arc Yinnar are holding an open entry exhibition where members and others will exhibit their warm winter stuff; anything that looks lusciously warm, glowing with Colour, grain or texture, sculptural or wearable, it will all be on display.
Arc Yinnar is an artist-run, non-profit organisation whose members are proud of the continued development of the art centre which today houses its administration base, gallery arc, retail outlet, theatrette, private studios and public access areas for printmaking, ceramics, metalwork, photography, painting and drawing.
For more information, please contact Art Yinnar.

item.title: Melbourne Regatta – Blessing of the Fleet
item.description:
Celebrate Melbourne's birthday, her maritime heritage, waterways and recognise the spiritual significance of all who sail upon the seas.
Father Bob will be presiding over the Blessing of the Fleet, celebrating those in peril on the sea. Victoria Harbour in Docklands will come alive with bands, street performers and local restaurants offering Melbourne Day specials. Harbour Esplanade will also be activated creating a spectacular arena for visitors to view the Blessing of the Fleet on the Basin within Victoria Harbour. For a visual extravaganza there will be a flotilla of vessels, flares, whistles, pipe bands and a display of water cannons from emergency service vessels on the harbour.
Further entertainment will include the Enterprize performing a re-enactment of the first landing in period costume, and the Alma Doepel volunteers will be sailing their recently restored traditional naval four oared captains gig. There will be storytelling about the first landing for kids as well as street entertainment including works of Shakespeare. To top things off, vessels will be available free of charge for short trips to enable visitors to experience the water and see Melbourne from a whole new perspective.

item.title: Wade Marynowsky: Autonomous Improvisation
item.description:
In August 2014 NGV Studio will host an extraordinary exhibition where visitors will be greeted by a group of bizarre interactive human-like robots that will be let loose in the foyer of NGV Australia.
Dr Wade Marynowsky is an anti-disciplinary artist who works across robotics, immersive and interactive installation, performance, music and video. His practice typically draws on technology and programmed structures to create works that straddle humour, high-camp and a host of unnerving thematic orientations to absorbing effect.
Autonomous improvisation will give an insight into Marynowsky's remarkable artistic practice. It will include interactive robotics, sound sculpture, audiovisual installations and performances. It will also reveal a surprising and dramatic new work that Marynowsky will be developing at NGV Studio during the course of the exhibition.

item.title: Striking Contrasts
item.description:
This screen based touring exhibition features ten contemporary Australian video artists, including Angelica Mesiti, John Conomos, Grant Stevens and Deborah Kelly.
Reflecting on two distinctive and opposite visions of the Australian cultural landscape, that of the vast centre to the built up city peripheries. The exhibition explores these contrasts through various techniques such as documentary film, narrative sequence and the use of found footage.
Curated by dLux MediaArts in association with Geoffrey Weary, Sydney College of the Arts, University of Sydney.

item.title: Kannamaroo Festival
item.description:
Kannamaroo Festival is an annual event with great family entertainment for all to enjoy and family fun activities.
The street carnival follows down Firebrace Street on Friday evening. The festival offers food, crafts, kids carnival rides, music and lots of live entertainment. Bring the family for late night shopping and enjoy the atmosphere. The festivities continue on the Saturday afternoon with skiing demonstrations on the Wimmera River.

item.title: 2014 Inline Hockey National Championships
item.description:
Skate Australia, the Inline Hockey Australia National Executive Committee and Skate Australia Victoria Inline Hockey(SAVI) are proud to announce the 2014 Inline Hockey National Championships will be heading to Geelong, Victoria this year!
The event will be staged from the 26th of September to the 4th of October at Geelong Arena. It has been nine years since Victoria has hosted the Inline Hockey National Championships.
Supported by the City of Greater Geelong, the National Championships will see teams all across Australia battle it out for the National Trophy.
This event also provides players with the opportunity to be selected for the 2015 Australian Representative teams that participate in Oceania and World Championships.

item.title: 150 Years of Rail to Echuca Celebration
item.description:
This year Echuca celebrates 150 Years of Rail. In 1864 the railway line was extended from Bendigo to Echuca, connecting the town and the riverboat trade directly to Victoria's capital city, Melbourne.
Steamrail Victoria will run short shuttle trips throughout the day, but get in quick if you wish to be on the celebratory train that will arrive at the station at approximately 10:30am. The train re-enacting the arrival of the first train 150 years ago will be met by the fanfare of special dignitaries, Echuca Federal Band, local steam traction engines and vintage cars.
Echuca Historical Society will host a train/rail photographic exhibition, release a commemorative booklet and unveil a plaque. Esma Turner will also have her book "Bendigo to Murray River Railway" available for sale.
item.ns0:organiser: 150 Years of Rail to Echuca Celebration Committee

item.title: Docklands – From Wetlands to Working Dock to Modern City
item.description:
Discover when Docklands was a vast wetlands and a popular hunting ground of the Kulin nation before being transformed to a major industrialised area in the late 1800s. Developments saw the course of the Yarra River changed dramatically and the creation of Victoria Dock. These new wharves became Victoria's busiest and one of the largest single docks in the world.
With containerisation changing the face of shipping in the 1950s and 1960s, more suitable ports were built further downstream in the 1950s and 1960s leaving this once bustling area as a disused wasteland that attracted much government attention as a critical area for regeneration. Modern Docklands is the creation of one of Australia's largest urban renewal projects and will significantly expand Melbourne's CBD upon completion. Docklands now houses several modern landmarks and has become a vibrant hub for workers, residents and visitors alike.

item.title: Point Lonsdale Market
item.description:
The Point Lonsdale Market is one of the larger and more popular markets on the Bellarine Peninsula.
The market features local produce from locally made jams to spuds straight from the farmer's cart. Lovers of art and craft are not forgotten either with plenty home made clothes and artworks up for great prices. All goods are home made, produced or grown. There are art and craft stalls and plant and food stalls.
This market is held on the second Sunday of the month, on Easter Saturday and the first Saturday in December.
There are approximately 150 stalls, indoor and outdoor, with goodies for the whole family.

item.title: Ballarat Lakeside Farmers Market
item.description:
The Ballarat Lakeside Farmers Market is a lively farmers market featuring boutique regional produce. This market is popular among the locals and visitors of Ballarat.
It is set in the scenic surrounds of Lake Wendouree. Shoppers can peruse and sample their way through the myriad of stallholders while enjoying the fine produce and music.
This is a dog friendly market and please make sure you bring your own bag or trolley.

item.title: ANL Maritime Art Exhibition
item.description:
Mission To Seafarers Victoria invites the public to attend Australia's leading maritime exhibition. Themed, 'The Relationship Between Humanity And The Sea', the exhibition, judged by an esteemed art prize committee, celebrates the sea and all things nautical. The exhibition of over 80 paintings will run at the Norla Dome Gallery, 717 Flinders Street, Docklands, from 3rd October to 31st October 2014.
Art aficionados and those who are drawn to the sea, admire the form of ships or simply dream of sailing will enjoy the exhibition, which showcases these subjects in all their majesty. The artwork will adorn the walls of The Norla Dome Gallery, itself a reason to attend the exhibition. An architectural wonder of some 95 years old, it was originally built as a gymnasium for seafarers. Currently used for weddings, exhibitions and other functions, the Dome Gallery will certainly enhance the ambience of the exhibition. Visitors cannot ask for a more unique setting.
Visitors are welcome to purchase the works, all of which will be for sale. A percentage of the sale price will goes toward the work of the Mission - supporting the well-being of seafarers. Globally, 1.4 million merchant sailors traverse the seas, transporting 95 per cent of world trade.
Enjoy!

item.title: Story Lounge
item.description:
Do you like to listen to a good story? Library at The Dock is introducing a storytime for adults.
Bring your lunch, relax, knit, dream or enjoy the view, as you are read a hand-picked story or two.
Story Lounge happens at noon, on the fourth Wednesday of the month, in the beautiful new Library at The Dock.

item.title: Sailing into Melbourne
item.description:
This winter, the Old Treasury Building will feature an impressive display of nautical history highlighting the extraordinary past of Melbourne's famous port.
Sailing into Melbourne will showcase major records from the collection of Public Record Office Victoria, covering grim stories of quarantine, devastating shipwrecks and grand voyages from Australia to Europe carrying large amounts of gold.
Entry is Free!

item.title: Paola Pivi – You Started It...I Finish It
item.description:
You Started It...I Finish It is an installation designed for Federation Court encompassing eight life-size sculptures of bears adorned with neon-coloured feathers. These flamboyant figures adopt various attitudes and guises: one bear leaps from a balcony; others approach each other as if to dance, or engage in deep philosophical conversation; others recline in carefree abandon.
Together they create a marvellous, enigmatic scene - of baroque excess and surreal desire, recalling fables and fairytales, dreams and allegories, where unexpected forms become strangely familiar and the pleasure principle prevails.

item.title: 60 minutes for MS
item.description:
60 Minutes for MS is a one-day reading based fundraising program coinciding with book week.
Spend an hour reading with friends, dress up as your favourite character, have a stall or use your imagination to create an event!
Be involved to make a difference to the lives of people living with MS.
All those who participate are eligible for rewards. Incentives are available for all schools, kinders, libraries and groups.

item.title: Bairnsdale Makers' Market
item.description:
Enjoy an extensive range of handmade clothing, craft, woodwork and other locally designed and created products. There's something for everyone, particularly the kids.
Indulge your creative side and support small business. The market is held indoors and runs rain, hail or shine.
Situated adjacent to the Bairnsdale Farmers' Market at the Bairnsdale Secondary College

item.title: Bairnsdale Farmers' Market
item.description:
Discover the finest produce in Gippsland at the Bairnsdale Farmers' Market on the first Saturday of the month.
You will discover the finest cheeses, dips, pesto's and marinates. This is your opportunity to obtain fresh vegetables, potatoes and pumpkin.
Enjoy a variety of fresh apples and rhubarb or pure honey or fudge or ice cream and berries.
The market is a great way to purchase your lamb or fresh lamb sausages, smoked meats and venison.
Take home some Dargo walnuts, goats milk and cheeses, pasta, jams and sauces, chutneys and eggs.
Check out the large variety of cakes, biscuits and organic breads, olive oil and vegetable soaps.
Purchase Australian native plants, flowers or check the range of potted colour and many other plants.
Finish your visit with the best of the local wines or a coffee or a freshly cooked breakfast.

item.title: Dawn to Dusk
Basil Sellers Art Prize 4
item.description:
Sport and art come together again with 16 finalists competing in the fourth biennial Basil Sellers Art Prize. With $100,000 awarded to the winner, this is one of Australia's richest and most prestigious art prizes.
The Basil Sellers Art Prize encourages artists to take on the theme of sport in any artistic medium and supports artists whose work explores Australia's obsession with sport.
The works of the finalists will be exhibited at the Ian Potter Museum of Art from 22 July to 26 October.

ns0:venue.name: Ian Potter Museum of Art, University of Melbourne

item.title: ANL Maritime Exhibition
item.description:
Experience an artful celebration of the sea, sailing and everything nautical at Australia's largest maritime exhibition.
Mission To Seafarers Victoria (MtSV) invites the public to attend Australia's leading maritime exhibition. Themed, 'The Relationship Between Humanity And The Sea', the exhibition, judged by an esteemed art prize committee, celebrates the sea and all things nautical.
Art aficionados and those who are drawn to the sea, admire the form of ships or simply dream of sailing will enjoy the exhibition, which showcases these subjects in all their majesty. The artwork will adorn the walls of The Norla Dome Gallery, itself a reason to attend the exhibition. An architectural wonder of some 95 years of age, it was originally built as a gymnasium for seafarers. Currently used for weddings, exhibitions and other functions, the Dome Gallery will enhance the ambience of the exhibition.
Visitors are welcome to purchase the works, all of which will be for sale. A percentage of the sale price will goes toward the work of the Mission – supporting the well-being of seafarers. Globally, 1.4 million merchant sailors traverse the seas, transporting 95 percent of world trade.

item.title: Take 2 Markets - Queen Victoria Market Pop Up
item.description:
Take 2 is Melbourne's longest running recycled fashion market is the place to buy and sell fabulous fashion.
Expect to find Australian and international designers, High Street brands plus some cool vintage and retro gear. Did we mention accessories? Shoes, hats, sunnies, jewellery - you name it!
Join the thousands of women who regularly shop with at the markets and find yourself something wonderful.
All the fashion and accessories will be priced to sell. You'll be an environmental fashionista without even trying.
Take 2 Markets will be at Queen Victoria Market in 'A Shed', corner of Peel and Victoria Streets, Melbourne.

item.title: Polly Borland: Wonky
item.description:
Polly Borland's series Wonky presents an idiosyncratic and touching meditation on love, juxtaposed with a unique selection of her documentary photographs, images that have informed Wonky.
Borland's initial inspiration for the series Wonky began when she relocated from London to Hollywood with its promise of glamour and prevailing artificiality. Throughout her career Borland has held a fascination for the Outsider, people living on the fringe of society. This she has more recently found in the 'ugly-beauty' of LA.
In a further shift from her stylized portraiture, Wonky's sculptured forms and staged photography reveal a darker influence at play. The selection of small scale photographs come from Borland's residency with Museum Victoria's Psychiatric Services collection, where she documented medical equipment and artefacts dating from 1870 to 1980. Borland was drawn to the collection of objects made by the patient's hand, the embroidery on a nightgown, a knitted doll and carved wooden figures, all imbued for Borland with an absence of love.
With each series, Borland invites speculation on familial relationships, those constructed by us and the ones we are born into. Borland probes these groupings, never allowing us to shy away from the sometimes disturbing nature of these relationships.
Polly Borland is represented by Murray White Room, Melbourne; Paul Kasmin Gallery, New York; and Other Criteria, London.
Polly Borland would like to acknowledge Dr Nurin Veis and Museum Victoria
A touring exhibition from the Centre for Contemporary Photography, Melbourne

item.title: Gembrook Market
item.description:
Come down to the Gembrook Market and see a wide range of mostly locally grown and made craft and produce for sale.
Find everything from Crafts, Jewellery, plants to soaps and other handmade goods and foods. Tantalise your taste buds with freshly brewed coffee, a range of sweet and savoury foods, a community barbecue operated by Gembrook Community groups available.
Stallholder and volunteer enquiries welcome.

item.title: Yarragon Market
item.description:
The monthly Yarragon Market has a range of art, craft and produce from the West Gippsland region.
Nestled in the foothills of the Strzelecki ranges with vistas of green rolling hills Yarragon Village is a charming country town with an abundance of delightful shops and places to eat to satisfy all desires.

item.title: Longwarry Fire Brigade Market
item.description:
The Longwarry Fire Brigade Market is a popular monthly market offering something for everyone: craft, produce, trash & treasure and much more.
Longwarry is located at the entrance to Baw Baw Shire and a good starting point to explore the region. Once you have stocked up at the market, why not visit one of the wineries in Labertouche, Warragul or Brandy Creek or head to one of the many walking trails in Baw Baw?
Held on the first Sunday of each month, with the exception January and February.

item.title: Drouin Craft & Produce Market
item.description:
The Rotary Club of Drouin presents this monthly Drouin Craft & Produce Market offering fresh produce, clothing, jewellery, plants, preserves and much more.
Held in beautiful Civic Park Drouin, the market has been on Baw Baw's market calendar for a number of years. Wander over to the Drouin CBD, which is only a one minute walk from the market and browse the variety of shops.

item.title: Yoga at Fed Square
item.description:
Improve your physical, mental and spiritual well-being with free lunchtime yoga classes at Fed Square.
Take a break from the busy city life and incorporate meditation and tranquillity into your day. Stretching and postures focus on controlled breathing to improve core strength and flexibility.
All skill levels welcome from beginners to advanced.

item.title: Warragul Farmers Market
item.description:
Warragul Farmers Market is a place for people to meet and support local farmers and producers and buy a huge range of fresh and hand made food.
More than 50 stallholders will be selling their locally-grown, locally-made products; from bread, to cheese, to olive oil to fresh fruit and vegetables and much more. Experience quality Gippsland grown and made food at beautiful Civic Park.
Warragul Farmers Market is held the third Saturday of each month, all year round.
Parking at the Arts Centre or Mason Street car parks.

item.title: Spread the Seeds of Love Tour
item.description:
Through inspiring music, cultural dance and quicksilver Chinese martial arts movements, the children of Africa at Amitofo Care Centre orphanages have showcased their talents and captured hearts across the world since 2007.
The Spread the Seeds of Love Tour's mission is to provide a world stage for these children to showcase their own potential and create hope for their future. Together, they help raise funds for fellow children orphaned by HIV/AIDS, and vulnerable children in their homeland.

image.altText: Spread the Seeds of Love Tour
Spread the Seeds of Love Tour

item.title: Improve Your Public Speaking and Gain Confidence
item.description:
If you're interested in practicing your presentation skills, clearly articulating ideas and improving your self-confidence, this workshop is for you.
Pushing the Envelope Toastmasters will help you nurture these skills by providing a supportive and friendly environment for you to develop and build your communication and leadership skills at your own pace. It's a diverse group with varied speaking skill levels and backgrounds. Meetings generally focus on three aspects of public speaking: prepared speeches, impromptu speaking, and giving speech evaluations.

item.title: Spread the Seeds of Love Tour 2014
item.description:
Through inspiring music, warm cultural dance and quicksilver Chinese martial arts movements the children of Africa at Amitofo Care Centre orphanages (ACC) have captured hearts across the world since 2007.
At the heart of the 2014 Spread the Seeds of Love Tour's mission will be to provide a world stage for our amazing children to showcase their own potential and have hope for their future. Together, they help raise funds for fellow orphans, orphaned by HIV/AIDS, and vulnerable children in their homeland.

ns0:venue.name: Box Hill Town Hall, Main Hall

item.title: Victor Hugo: Les Misérables - From Page to Stage
item.description:
Take a journey from the 19th-century Paris of Victor Hugo's novel, Les Misérables to today's blockbuster stage musical at the Sate Library of Victoria.
Featuring rare items from the collections of the Bibliothèque nationale de France, Maison de Victor Hugo, Musée Rodin, Cameron Mackintosh Archive and others, this exhibition is a world-first insight into the most popular French story of all time.
Exclusive to the State Library of Victoria, the exhibition takes you on a themed, multi-sensory exploration of:
- Original drawings and watercolours by Victor Hugo - Rare scripts, scores, designs and posters from the 1985 Royal Shakespeare Company production - Original costumes and designs from the cinematic portrayals of Les Misérables - including the 2012 film starring Anne Hathaway and Hugh Jackman - An entire gallery, including interactive displays, dedicated to the current Melbourne stage musical, giving visitors the chance to dress up and take centre stage.
Opening in July 2014, to coincide with the arrival of Cameron Mackintosh's acclaimed new production of Les Misérables in Melbourne, this collection of iconic rarities is not to be missed.

item.title: Vincent St Makers Market
item.description:
The Vincent Street Makers Market is located inside Daylesford Town Hall in the main street of the beautiful township of Daylesford.
The market showcases high quality unique and boutique handmade products by talented local and regional designers and artists.
Offering a wide variety of handmade stalls, they always love to hear from new designers, artists and makers.

item.title: Inge King: Constellation
item.description:
At the forefront of Australian abstract sculpture for more than six decades, the formidable career of Inge King AM will be celebrated with a major survey at the National Gallery of Victoria in May.
Now in her 99th year, King is one of the country’s most respected artists, holding a distinguished place in Australian art history.
Inge King: Constellation will be staged throughout the foyer spaces across NGV Australia’s three levels. It will present 92 works, from small maquette studies to larger, full-scale pieces, alongside King’s recent sculptures and collages, her lesser-unknown jewellery designs and many early works, some of which have never been on public display.

ns0:venue.name: National Gallery of Victoria: Ian Potter Centre

item.title: Fashion Detective
item.description:
More than 70 unattributed garments and accessories from the National Gallery of Victoria's world-class Fashion and Textiles Collection will be examined under the microscope in 'Fashion Detective', an intriguing, investigative exhibition that seeks to uncover the people and histories behind these extraordinary pieces. Using material evidence, hearsay and forensics, along with specially commissioned fictional stories, the exhibition considers these fascinating pieces drawn from the NGV's extensive collection of over 8,000 items.
Tony Ellwood, Director, NGV said, 'While the NGV holds one of the most substantial collections of fashion and textiles in the world, there are a large number of works that remain unattributed, and this is common throughout museum collections world-wide. These enigmatic objects incite our curiosity and make us question how these objects came to be; who created them, why were they made and who wore them? Fashion Detective will present a series of cases for close examination encouraging visitors to think differently about what we see and what we know,' Mr Ellwood said.
From poisonous dyes, concealed clues, mysterious marks, fakes and forgeries, to missing persons, 'Fashion Detective' is comprised of small vignettes that reveal the extraordinary stories behind these garments. Displayed within a stylised black and white exhibition design reminiscent of an ornate Victorian house, the exhibition will be a compelling encounter with the art of detection and the long forgotten makers and owners.

item.title: David McDiarmid: When This You See Remember Me
item.description:
Defying classification, the work of David McDiarmid encompasses the complex and interconnected histories of art, craft, fashion, music, sex, gay liberation and identity politics; happily residing in the spaces between high and low art, popular culture and community engagement.
At once kaleidoscopic, celebratory and darkly humorous in tone, the artist's idiosyncratic, highly personal and at times, confessional work highlights the redefinition and deconstruction of identities - 'from camp to gay to queer' - drawing on the experiences of a life intensely lived in Melbourne, Sydney and New York.
Charting the shifts in politics and individual and community expression that unfold across the decades of the 1970s, 80s and 90s, this exhibition also reveals McDiarmid's artistic and grassroots political response to the impact of HIV/AIDS during the 1980s and beyond, for which he is best known internationally.

ns0:venue.name: The Ian Potter Centre: NGV Australia

item.title: Projector Bike Free Friday Night Rides
item.description:
Projector Bike joins the City of Melbourne in a winter celebration.
Start your weekend with a bang with free Friday night fireworks at Docklands.
Bring the family, rally your friends and come early to enjoy the entertainment, get a prime view at one of the waterfront restaurants or rug up and enjoy the show from New Quay Promenade.
Projector Bike will bringing its unique mobile cinema and be showing award-winning short films.
Catch up with us via Twitter updates.
This is a free event for all-ages.
Presented by City of Melbourne.
** Please note Friday August 22nd - Docklands Winter Fireworks

item.title: Main Street Mornington Festival
item.description:
The Main Street Mornington, Food, Wine and Performing Arts Festival is a local favourite event and this year is looking to be even better than last year's hugely successful 18th celebrations!
Many visitors from afar are also attracted to the Festival, where the best of Mornington Peninsula's gourmet produce, boutique wineries, visual artists, musicians, dance troupes, circus, fashion boutiques, singer songwriters, cooks, and theatre groups are proudly showcased.
This free family friendly event will host lots of exciting music and entertainment throughout the day, with local artists and performers performing on various stages throughout the day.
The ever popular fashion show will be held during the festivities, allowing local boutiques to highlight the lovely spring fashions, just in time for Spring Carnival racing.
Mornington is infamous for its exclusive boutiques, and the high fashion shopping on the main strip is an experience in itself, so there is plenty of shopping to be done at the Festival!
Food and wine stalls will be set up throughout the Festival, and the children's arcade will be back once again to entertain all the youngsters.

item.title: Valkstone Primary School Fair
item.description: Valkstone Primary is holding their school fete on Sunday 9th November 2014. Starting at 10am come along for a great day of fun for all the family. There will be rides, games, great food and coffee. Held on the school grounds of Valkstone Primary in Valkstone Street, Bentleigh East. Come and celebrate an enjoyable day out with our community.

item.title: Family Fun Day - Holy Rosary School
item.description:
Plans for the Holy Rosary Family Fun Day on Saturday 15 November 2014 are well underway, promising to be bigger and better than ever. The Fun Day is being held at the Holy Rosary School Grounds at 37 Gower Street in Kensington and will run from 10am to 3pm. Entry is free and there will be lots of free entertainment for all the family. Activities and stalls are still being confirmed but in previous years the community has enjoyed:
• Face painting • Children’s Rides • Auction • Cakes, breads and preserves • Plants and flowers • Asian Food and BBQ • Fairy Floss • Snow Cones • Books • 2nd hand clothing and toys • Demonstrations from community organisations • Money tree • Craft • Major raffle • And much more!
With plenty of family-friendly things to see and do, grab your children and get ready for the Holy Rosary Family Fun Day.
Come along rain, hail or shine!

item.title: Docklands Winter Fireworks
item.description:
In light of the tragic loss of life on Malaysian Airlines flight 17, including those travelling to Melbourne for 20th International AIDS Conference, the City of Melbourne has cancelled tonight's Docklands fireworks.
Start your weekend during July and August with free Friday night fireworks at Docklands.
Bring the family, rally your friends and come early to enjoy the entertainment, get a prime view at one of the waterfront restaurants or rug up and enjoy the show from New Quay Promenade. There's music and fun to keep everyone entertained, before and after the fireworks, along the promenade and piazza at New Quay.
Fireworks program:
18 July - Fireworks have been cancelled 25 July – Projector Bike, EL Suits 1 August – First Friday Dance Club (Bollywood) and The Clouds 8 August – '200 Torches' and Lolka 15 August – Storytelling with Niki na Meadhra and Pirates 22 August – Projector Bike and African Drumming 29 August – Little Wings Puppets, The Thankful Tree, The Clouds
Fireworks start at 7pm.
Note: the fireworks on Friday 18 July have been cancelled

item.title: Indonesia Street Festival
item.description:
The Annual Indonesia Street Festival brings together the Indonesian Community living and supporting in the state of Victoria. This annual event ensures community collaborations and opportunities for the Indonesian businesses to showcase the best of culture, taste, sights and sounds of Indonesia.
This events also celebrate a significant day in Indonesian tradition called Kartini Day. This event symbolises Mothers day and a day celebrating women's role within Indonesian society.
There will be 20 restaurants featuring traditional and authentic Indonesian cuisine added with the twist of high quality food from the South East Asian neighbours. They will definitely ensure your taste buds are fulfilled. Immerse yourself in the wonderful traditional dancers from the Indonesian archipelago from Sumatra, to the Eastern sea of Indonesia.
Come dressed in your traditional Indonesian outfits and enjoy this wonderful celebration.
item.ns0:organiser: Alive Group Indonesia Muslim Community Victoria

item.title: Open Garden Weekend
item.description:
The private homestead garden at Warratina Lavender Farm will be open again this year to the public on the 29 and 30 November.
There will be garden walks around the homestead and along the driveway displaying a range of salvias, roses, rhododendrons, azaleas and more.
The first lavenders will be in full bloom giving you a magnificent display of purple in the fields.
Lavender harvesting will be demonstrated using traditional methods as well as demonstrations of old-time crafts, wood turning, spinning and lace-making.
Market stalls, food vendors, music, Devonshire teas, luncheons and children's entertainment are all part of the weekend.
Proceeds from the day will be donated to the local CFA.

item.title: Art Show at Warrantina Lavender Farm
item.description:
The annual Art Show at Warratina Lavender Farm is sure to impress.
All types of paintings will be on show and for sale. There will be framed paintings, unframed paintings, cards, and more all for sale.
The Show is supported by members of the Mt Evelyn andrra Valley Art Society.
Devonshire teas, all day breakfasts and luncheons will be available throughout the show.

image.altText: view of lavender from Tea Rooms

item.title: Wild Awards 2014
item.description:
Held at Victorian Artists Society Galleries the Wildlife Art Society of Australasia invites you to the 40th anniversary celebrations of the Society at the Wild Awards 2014. The exhibition and sale of wildlife artworks featuring 2 and 3-D artworks including works from WASA's Life members.
Many Australian multi award-winning artists are represented. In support of Birdlife Australia.

item.title: Improve Your Public Speaking
item.description:
If you are interested in practicing your presentation skills, clearly articulating ideas and improving your self-confidence, then Pushing the Envelope Toastmasters can help you to nurture these skills.
Toastmasters International is a non-profit educational organisation that teaches public speaking and leadership skills through a worldwide network of meeting locations.
The club provides a supportive and friendly environment for you to develop and build your communication and leadership skills at your own pace.

item.title: Tarwin Lower Local Seasonal Market
item.description:
Held at Tarwin Lower Primary School; come down to the Tarwin Lower Seasonal Market, bring the whole family and make a fun day of it.
Stalls include, local produce, arts and crafts, poultry and pets, food, plants entertainment and much more.
For more information on the market, please see the Facebook page.

item.title: Wentworth Country Music Rotary Main Street Market
item.description:
Join the fun and support our community with the Rotary Club of Wentworth. Supporting the Wentworth rotary market, supports the work our Rotary club does in our community.
The market brings people and their community together for the festivities, fun and entertainment of a traditional village market.
Enjoy the variety of stalls and display, it's fun for the whole family.
Free entry into Gate Prize Draw to be drawn at the 30 November market.

item.title: Jack 'n' Jill Children's Market
item.description:
Located in Ballarat Jack 'n' Jill Children's Market is a beautiful market place full of gorgeous handmade, unique and boutique children and babies products. With over 40 stall holders from local and surrounding areas, designers showcasing their beautiful creations.
Our market is the only handmade children's market in Ballarat and is held rain, hail or shine as it all indoors and is also free to enter.
Ballarat is situated just over an hours drive from Melbourne via the Western Freeway, one hour from Geelong and 35 minutes from Daylesford.

item.title: Meet the Alpacas - Creswick Natural Fibres in Elsternwick and Hawthorn
item.description:
With the cooler months, it can be a challenge to find something a little different to keep your kids entertained. Why not bring them to the Creswick Natural Fibre store in Elsternwick and Hawthorn Stores to meet the alpaca family?
Did you know that alpacas belong to the same family as camels? These gentle animals communicate by humming and love chasing each other up and down the paddock. They are very inquisitive and enjoy being patted and fed.
Come any time to feed the Alpacas, they are always hungry! This is an opportunity to meet the friendly alpaca family members in the South Eastern Suburbs of Melbourne. Entry is free and parking available. There is just no reason to miss it.
Elsternwick address: 426 Glenhuntly Road Elsternwick Hawthorn address: 6 Roche St Hawthorn

image.altText: Alpacas at Creswick Natural Fibres Elsternwick

item.title: Dandenong Ranges Open Studios Weekend
item.description:
The Dandenong Ranges Open Studios will take place on April 18 and 19 and is an opportunity for art lovers to take a behind-the-scenes look into the life and work of the region's finest designers, painters, makers and sculptors.
An invitation to observe an artist's life. For a single weekend this autumn, you are invited to experience the world that unfolds within the working studios of artists in the charming Dandenong Ranges.

address.address1: Cnr Glenfern Road and Matson Drive

item.title: Poetry at Fed Square
item.description:
Each month different poets present their new works in a public setting to an ever-changing audience. It is an opportunity to hear new words and voices.
Readers and presenters come from all walks of literary life: some are published authors; some are translators; some are first time authors with a piece of work in progress to test; while others will read/present a bilingual writing of another author. Over the years, more than 1000 different poets, translators and open readers have participated in the program.
The regular format allows for feature presenters, reading up to 20 minutes each.
There is also an open mic section for those wanting to share their lovely words for just five minutes each. Please do not hesitate to come forward to ask to read.
Held on the third Saturday of each month.

item.title: Creswick Market
item.description:
Located in the picturesque and historic township of Creswick, just 20 minutes to either Ballarat or Daylesford the Creswick Market a great day out for the whole family.
The Creswick Market is held the third Saturday of every month, from 9am to 1pm. Bring the kids and your four-footed friends, all are welcome.
Free live music and over 60 specialist boutique sites, offering a variety of unique handmade goods ranging from arts and crafts to freshly made delicacies, something for everyone. Talk directly to producers and designers, learn about the ingredients and processes that brought the item to you.
The market features: gourmet take away food and great coffee; live music; kids entertainment and playground; beautiful gardens to relax in; historic township to explore; hand made arts, crafts, jewellery, clothes, home grown fruit, vegetables, plants and other produce.
Creswick Market is a much-loved monthly event, with the true relaxed feel of a regional craft market. A must see for all residents and visitors of the Goldfield region.

item.title: Feel Young
item.description:
Drawing from ancient Chinese traditions, Feel Young combines gentle exercise and dance in a program suitable for all ages.
Led by expert instructors from the Federation of Chinese Associations, Feel Young is designed to invigorate the mind and the body, building fitness, balance and mobility.
Classes are held on the second and fourth Thursday of every month, 10.30am - 12.30pm.
All ages are welcome and bookings not required.

item.title: Belly Dancing at Fed Square
item.description:
Shimmy and shake with free 30 minute Belly Dancing at Fed Square classes.
Led by professional instructor Trisnasari, the gentle aerobic dance is perfect for toning and strengthening core muscles.
Classes are held on the second and fourth Thursday of each month, from 12.30pm until 1pm. No bookings required.
All ages and skill levels welcome.

item.title: Once upon a time: a world of children’s picture book art
item.description:
Let your imagination run wild in this free exhibition celebrating the world of children's picture book art. See classic characters like Blinky Bill and the Magic Pudding, as well as fun favourites including Miffy, Grandma Poss and Old Tom. You'll also see aliens and fairies, tigers and bears, cranky cats, playful pups and a dinosaur who does the dishes!
Look at original drawings, dummy books and videos about the artworks to discover the magic behind creating illustrated stories, then create your own story with our free activity booklet. Relax afterwards by snuggling up with a cushion and a book in the reading pod.
This delightful exhibition showcases the world-renowned Scholastic Dromkeen Children's Literature Collection.

item.title: Laughter Club
item.description:
Join in this free laughter session at Federation Square and experience the benefits of a good old chuckle.
Laughter has been shown to improve the physical, mental, emotional, spiritual and social health of individuals, workplaces and society. Get together for a medicinal belly laugh at Fed Square!
First and third Sunday of every month.

item.title: Crochet at Fed Square
item.description:
Crochet workshops are led by a small group of volunteer crochet enthusiasts who are working towards making poppies for the '5000 Poppies project'.
This arts and craft project gives crafters of all persuasions an opportunity to contribute to a large community tribute of respect and remembrance to Australian servicemen and women who have fought in all wars, conflicts and peacekeeping operations.
The goal of the 5000 poppies project is to create a field of 5000 poppies for display on ANZAC Day 2015, as part of Australia's 100th Anniversary commemoration of the Gallipoli landing.
Workshops are held on the second Monday of every month.
Please note that the workshop in April 2014 will be on Friday 25 April in commemoration of ANZAC Day.

item.title: Boroondara Farmers Market
item.description:
Visit the Boroondara Farmers Market every month to buy delicious, fresh produce. Held at Patterson Reserve on the third and fifth Saturday of the month, the market is a great day out for the whole family.
If you are passionate about food and the planet, join a dedicated group of farmers and locals who are as passionate as you are.
The Boroondara Farmers Market sells produce from all around Victoria. You can buy fresh fruit and vegetables, seasonal organic produce, meat, herbs, honey, eggs, bread, olives, cakes, dips and sauces, even wine and beer.
Talk directly to producers and learn about the ingredients and processes that brought the food to you. It's all part of shopping in a community, reducing food miles and supporting small Victorian primary producers. Bring the kids and your four-footed friends - you're all welcome.
The market is accredited with the Victorian Farmers Market Association and proudly supports the principles behind genuine farmers markets. For more information, visit the website.
The Boroondara Farmers' Market is an initiative of the City of Boroondara in partnership with the Rotary Club of Glenferrie. All money raised assists with community projects run by Rotary of Glenferrie and Foundation Boroondara.

item.title: Mildura Revisited: Sculptures Exhibited 1961-1978
item.description:
Curated by Ken Scarlett, Mildura Revisited: Sculptures Exhibited 1961-1978 will focus attention on the Mildura Sculpture Triennials and the influence of gallery directors Ernst Van Hattum and Tom McCullough.
The exhibition will consist of works in the Mildura Arts Centre collection, supplemented with works on loan from State and Regional Galleries and private collections.
Photographs of ephemera earth works, installations and performances will be displayed on the walls of the gallery.

item.title: Coopers Australian Music Prize
item.description:
Five of the shortlisted artists of this year's Coopers Australian Music Prize will perform live showcase sets as part of the Australia Day Concert at the Bowl.
The Coopers AMP is about discovering, promoting and rewarding excellence in Australian music.
Stay tuned for 2015's program to be announced for another brilliant day out!

item.title: Easter Powersports Show and Sine
item.description: The Easter Powersports weekend is a significant event on the Mildura events calendar. Easter Powersports comprises of four sporting clubs who run major sporting competitions over the Easter weekend. These clubs include: Mildura Ski Club, Sunraysia Drag Racing Association, Timmis Speedway and Mildura Motorcycle Club. The Show and Shine which is held on Good Friday each year, provides a showcase of all the various powersports vehicles in a vibrant, exciting high octane atmosphere.

item.title: Emerald Market
item.description:
Emerald Market is held on the third Sunday of each month and has become a meeting place for locals and tourist alike.
The stallholders have a varied offering; organic and local produce, speciality food items, handmade and vintage clothing and gift ware, plants and ornaments, and gourmet hot food.
The market is open from 9am in Kilvington Drive, Emerald and is a short stroll from the Emerald Puffing Billy station.
The market has a vibrant atmosphere with buskers and performers.

item.title: Hamilton Farmers and Craft Market
item.description:
The Hamilton Farmers' and Craft Market showcases local produce and local designers.
Enjoy a sausage sizzle, while your browse the stalls, with stalls showcasing local wine, local produce, crafts, arts and food.
The Hamilton Farmers and Craft Market is a monthly market usually held on the last Saturday of month.

item.title: SunFest - Sunbury Community Festival
item.description:
SunFest's, now approaching its 39th year is held on the third weekend of March each year on the Village Green in Sunbury,
The free to enter two day festival is full of fun and entertainment for all ages.
SunFest is well supported by local traders, businesses, residents, the community and visitors from all around Melbourne and Country Victoria.
With thousands of people attending SunFest each year, we will again offer great attractions on our main stage and dance floor with local talent, and national acts, Battle of the School Choirs, SunFest Talent Shows, award winning entertainers and children's entertainment.
For the last 39 years we have been running our ever popular Grand Street Parade. Again this year we have Sunbury Idol and are introducing Sunbury Can Dance and our ever popular Reardon Amusement Rides and Carnival Games, Roving Entertainers, Walk and Run for FUN, a Health and Safety Expo and much, much more.

item.title: Women's Federation of World Peace in the City – Her Story
item.description:
Come along and share in the stories of extraordinary women.
Women's Federation for World Peace Victoria International's worldwide network of national and local chapters seeks to realise a peaceful and harmonious global family through four major activities worldwide:
- Service projects targeting the empowerment of women and children through supporting the UN Millennium Development goals. - The peace-building 'Bridge of Peace' sisterhood project that focuses on reconciliation, forgiveness and healing between people. - Educational seminars and forums that seek to raise society towards a stronger moral value system. - The Global Women's Peace Network is a network of women leaders who are peace builders within society. The GWPN is a project of WFWP International.
Local chapters embrace women of all ages, faiths, cultures and nationalities. They are committed to offering opportunities for women to discover their inherent value and create lasting peace starting at the family level.
The third Sunday of January, April, July and October.

item.title: Heads Up! - Winning Grants: Writing for Success
item.description:
Research the best grant to suit your organisation's needs. Write efficiently and successfully with a solid project plan and realistic budget. Manage relationships with grant makers and learn the best ways to present your proposal. This session includes information about Stonnington's Arts and Cultural Sponsorship program.
Stonnington’s HeadsUp! workshops deliver support and expert advice to help strengthen community based organisations. The workshops are designed to address current issues facing non-profit organisations and can assist all staff and associates, from board members to staff and volunteers as a valuable professional development tool.
All workshops will be held from 6.30pm to 8.30pm at the rear of Malvern Town Hall in the Banquet Room, corner High Street and Glenferrie Road. Free carparking is available.
The sessions are free and places are limited. Light refreshments provided. Book now by emailing headsup@stonnington.vic.gov.au or call 8290 1333.
Presented by Patrick Moriarty. Patrick is Director of Training and Development at Our Community, a world leading social enterprise and peak practice advisory body for not-for profit organisations.

address.address1: Cnr High Street and Glenferrie Road

image.altText: Heads Up! - Winning Grants: Writing for Success

item.title: Heads Up! Social Media and non-profits
item.description:
Social media is becoming an integral part of life online as social websites and applications proliferate. Explore some social media platforms and see what they can offer non-profits.
Stonnington’s HeadsUp! workshops deliver support and expert advice to help strengthen community based organisations. The workshops are designed to address current issues facing non-profit organisations and can assist all staff and associates, from board members to staff and volunteers as a valuable professional development tool.
All workshops will be held from 6.30pm to 8.30pm at the rear of Malvern Town Hall in the Banquet Room, corner High Street and Glenferrie Road. Free carparking is available.
The sessions are free and places are limited. Light refreshments provided. Book now by emailing headsup@stonnington.vic.gov.au or call 8290 1333.
Presented by Debra Templar. Debra assists small-medium and independent organisations and retailers in doing business in an ever-changing world. Debra is now is one of Australia's leading keynote speakers and business coaches.

address.address1: Cnr High Street and Glenferrie Road

image.altText: Heads Up! Social Media and non-profits

item.title: 2014 Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship
item.description:
The sixth edition of the Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship will be held from October 23-26, 2014, at the prestigious Royal Melbourne Golf Club in Melbourne, located in Victoria, Australia.
The Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship is the leading amateur golf event in the region. Previous winners include Hideki Matsuyama, now ranked within the world's top 50, and Guan Tianlang, the 14 year old Chinese schoolboy who took the golfing world by storm when he made the cut at the Masters Tournament last year.
The Royal Melbourne Golf Club has two courses, the East Course and the West Course, which are ranked amongst the best in the world. The 2013 Australian Masters and 2013 World Cup were both staged at this beautiful golf club, where some of the world's top-10 golfers, such as Adam Scott, Matt Kuchar and Jason Day, played on this magnificently golf course.
The winner of the Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship will receive an invitation to play in the 2015 Masters Tournament, and, together with the runner(s)-up, will earn a place in International Final Qualifying for the 2015 Open Championship.

image.altText: Korea's Lee Chang-woo celebrates with the Asia-Pacific Amateur Championship (AAC) trophy
Champion Lee Chang-woo earned a berth at the 2014 Masters Tournament as well as a spot in International Final Qualifying for next year's Open Championship

item.title: Patchewollock Music Festival
item.description:
The Patchewollock Music Festival will delivery a bush music festival that will showcase the art forms of music, theatre, spoken word and workshops using two outdoor stages.
Using headline acts from near and far with local acts from throughout our wider region, this event will bring together many communities within nort-west Victoria.
The Patchewollock Music Festival nestled in classic sunburnt Victorian outback is laid-back, family friendly with free entertainment for all tastes, with a wonderful variety of live music, poetry, children's entertainment, jamming and impromptu performances and there is even free camping.

item.title: Myrtleford Cotters Market
item.description:
The Cotters Market is an intimate market, presented by The Myrtleford Festival Committee focusing on locally grown and produced foods, crafts and items.
Stallholders are from North East Victoria and surrounding areas and all items for sale are grown or made by the stallholder.
The Cotters Market stallholder registration form is available from the Myrtleford Festival Visitor Information Centre and the Myrtleford Neighbourhood Centre, or alternatively it can be downloaded from the website.
Book a stall or come along and find some great items to buy!

item.title: Untitled – Michael Prior and Benjamin Ducroz
item.description:
The work of Benjamin Ducroz and Michael Prior is united through a shared fascination with cycles, polyrhythms and the mechanics of film and sound. This exhibition combines two new works, Stop Cycle and Florid Organum.
The shared formal and temporal relationships between the works create an immersive environment of endlessly shifting synchronicities that appeal to the brain's natural urge to find order.

item.title: Time Lapse
item.description: Christopher Handran is a Brisbane-based artist whose practice explores the mediation of experience by technologies and seeks to foreground the perceptual dimensions of spectatorship. Time Lapse brings together two such technologies, the camera obscura and the clock. Most often cited as a precursor to the photographic camera, the camera obscura is also an apparatus that historically informed the understanding of perception and acted as a model for conceiving of the perceiving subject. This exhibition places the spectator inside this historical apparatus, creating a space in which to watch time passing?

item.title: The Sculptor’s Photograph
item.description:
The Sculptor's Photograph interrogates the relationship between sculpture and photography. Mimicking Brancusi's practice of photographing his own sculptures, Emma Hamilton's black and white photographs her sculptural work harness light and shadow to create a dramatic alternative set of 'documentation'.
The images become works in their own right, revealing moments that we cannot see within the physical work.

item.title: The Discussion Room
item.description:
The urban environment is bloated with conviction: this is the best sneaker, this IS the best burger, this IS the best number to call if you are depressed.
The opportunity for questions and dialogue becomes lost in the mosquito swarm of slogans and sales pitches that surround us.
The Discussion Room cracks open a case of conversations to get the contradictory juices flowing. Just drop by for free food for thought or jump in with your own contributions.
Bring your own opinions.

item.title: Smash Your Head on the Punk Rock
item.description: Smash Your Head On The Punk Rock involves the deconstruction and reconstruction of various relationships between conceptualised and physical interpretations of space. Starting from the idea that folk music is the foundation of Punk Rock, these seemingly disparate entities born from the same conceptual intention, are deciphered and presented through various layered imagery positioned within abstraction.

image.altText: Smash Your Head on the Punk Rock

item.title: Milksop
item.description: A fetish may be defined as an object or idea regarded with awe and imbued with a potent magical spirit. A fetish may also refer to any object, idea or non-genital part of the body that causes habitual erotic response or fixation. It is with the above in mind that these three Sydney based artists share an awareness of the importance of art as both fantasy and fetish, as well as a belief that art should elicit reflection not only within the viewer but importantly also within the maker. The three artists have very singular practices; their art-making is both solitary and habitual. Their work tests the relationship between art, artist and audience creating a tension between each. Bodies and thoughts are made palpable and fleshy whether through sewing, taxidermy, video, painting, or other media, a personal human reaction is doggedly desired if not forced.

item.title: Maiden, Mother, Crone
item.description:
Maiden, Mother, Crone expands Aldhan's research in contemporary feminist studies and alternative spiritualities, responding to the modern-female experience via the neo-pagan triple-goddess allegory.
New video and sculptural work depict the body in states of transgression and receptivity, subjugated by a wide range of social and cultural mechanisms, threading together ideas about ritual, gender, identity and the grotesque.

item.title: Kraftwerk – Man Machine
item.description: At a time of such diversity of artistic practice, Kraftwerk: Man Machine brings together four Melbourne-based artists who utilise traditional craft disciplines both conventionally and unconventionally. Rejecting the perceived disconnection between thinking and making set in motion during the industrial revolution when a machine could replace the artisan, these artists think through making, exploring the role on craftsmanship within their collective practices.

item.title: Blueherring Pop-up
item.description:
The Blueherring pop-up is a mini-exhibition and retail stand for photographic artwork about Melbourne.
Unique memories and moments of Melbourne are available on quality cards, calendars, fridge magnets, limited edition prints, canvases, and other one-off artworks. All work is created by local Melbourne artist and photographer, Analise.
Artwork focuses on architecture, Melbourne's famous laneways and other iconic scenes.

item.title: Blindside Festival – Meet the Public
item.description:
This event features a series of Commissions by four Australian artists and art collectives, who explore the parameters for artist and audience engagement through live art, participatory and site-specific interventions, and inter-subjective encounters.
Each commissioned project will transform Gallery One over three days, through participatory design or explorations in social practice where the public becomes central to the work. A workshop or performance is also presented as an extension of each project, allowing structures and concepts for audience interaction to be further investigated.
Collision, a space for ideas to collide and populate, will be presented in Gallery Two over the duration of the festival. Featuring a built conversation pit, visitors are invited to perform their own interventions utilising a variety of modes of communication and technologies.
A dedicated publication, featuring three critical essays by Australian arts writers, will be published, and art debate, an event with guest speakers who will debate what the role of the public is in art practice today, will be presented in conjunction with the Festival.
Blindside invites you to meet the public.

item.title: Moyneyana Festival
item.description:
The Moyneyana Festival is in its 67th year and is known for its enduring tribute to community spirit. The festival runs over five weeks from Christmas Eve through to Australia Day each year.
The Festival has developed over the years to become a favourite summer celebration in the south-west of Victoria. Initiated in 1947, the festival helps to raise funds for the local hospital, and attracts crowds of 15,000 visitors each year.
The 3YB Coast FM Moyneyana Festival is considered one of the longest running community festivals in Australia. Its longevity attests to the community support it enjoys.
Almost all featured events are free and held in the main street, the village green or other public spaces. The only pre-requisite for the festival is to bring a picnic blanket or folding chairs. Come join them for Moyneyana Festival's Australia Day celebrations and all the other fun activities they have planned until then.
Moyneyana Festival is free, fun, simple and everyone is welcome. Please contact or view website for further information.

item.title: Fitness at Fed Square
item.description:
Get active with free Fitness at Fed Square, led by health coaches and fitness instructors from Healthy Lifestyle Lounge.
These classes, aimed to help city workers keep fit and healthy, include circuit-based exercise which incorporates body weight exercises, cardio training and core strength movements.
Classes are simple, fun and great for invigorating the mind, body and soul. All ages and fitness levels welcome.
In the case of wet weather, classes will be held in the Atrium.

item.title: Northern Regards Artisan Market
item.description:
The Northern Regards Artisan Market is a partnership with Thornbury Women's Neighbourhood House and Northcote Social Club to bring a quality, highly curated market featuring sustainable handmade wares to one of Melbourne's thriving high streets.
Now, we know what you are thinking; not another market in Melbourne? And yes, it is another market in Melbourne. However the organisers believe that Northern Regards Artisan Market fills a gap in the current Melbourne market scene. Northern Regards Artisan Market is focused on attracting artisans that have a strong sustainable, up-cycled and recycled feel to their work.
Located in the band room of the iconic Northcote Social Club, we are Melbourne's only handmade market dedicated to all things handmade and sustainable. Our clever artisans and makers use sustainable techniques and materials. They also found the beauty in what others discard.

item.title: Wodonga Children's Fair 2014
item.description:
Held during National Children's Week, the action-packed 'Games of yesteryear' program will be interactive and entertaining, featuring, live performances on three stages, hands on interaction with farm animals, emergency services education displays, come and try sporting activities, construction vehicle display, early years community services and organisations and interactive arts hall.
In the lead-up to the event, there will be various free and discounted activities that will take place around Wodonga to celebrate Children's Week (October 18 to October 26).

image.altText: Children applying their skills to build a house

item.title: The changing face of Victoria
item.description:
The changing face of Victoria exhibition brings together historical artefacts, photographs, drawings, maps, letters and diaries to tell the stories of the people, places and events that have shaped life in Victoria over the past 200 years.
Located in the Dome Galleries overlooking the magnificent La Trobe Reading Room, the first section of the exhibition focuses on the early years of European settlement, daily life in rural Victoria, and the events and mythology surrounding that most famous Victorian, Ned Kelly.
Items on regular display include key artefacts such as the Batman Deeds, the last notes of Burke and Wills and Ned Kelly's armour.
In addition to these iconic pieces, The changing face of Victoria also features less well-known objects which will change over time. These include photographs, diaries and letters that bring individual people and aspects of everyday Melbourne and Victoria during the 20th and 21st centuries to life.
The exhibition contains a newly donated 133-year-old letter detailing the capture of Ned Kelly at the siege of Glenrowan. The letter is currently on public display with an iPad which allows users to view more than 60 pages of content and images of Ned Kelly including his armour, photos, letters and more through a new Ned Kelly app.

image.altText: Winslow’s Roller Skates and packaging, belonging to Ruby Beyer at the age of 22 months, 1889, Realia

item.title: Sunday Afternoon in the Gardens 2014 / 2015
item.description:
Sunday Afternoon in the Gardens
Bring a chair and enjoy a pleasant Sunday afternoon at the Hamilton Botanic Gardens. Make a day of it and bring the whole family along.
Held throughout the summer months, enjoy listening to some local performances.
Time: 2.00pm - 4.00pm
Performances will be held in the Gardens Rotunda.
(Cancelled if inclement weather)

item.title: Mansfield Farmers' Market
item.description:
Accredited by the Victorian Farmers Market Association, the Mansfield Farmers' Market is a fresh and artisan produce market held year-round in the median strip opposite the Post Office - right in the centre of Mansfield, on the fourth Saturday of the month.
Over 30 colourful marquees set up on the grassy median strip right in the middle of town, showcasing the best fresh and artisan produce from the region, such as cheese, sour dough bread, olive oil, free-range meats and eggs and fresh fruit and vegetables.
With visitors able to interact with the people who have grown or made the food, the market promotes a greater awareness of food provenance and food miles.
The Mansfield Farmers' Market is a great way to buy fresh food as well as catch up with friends.

image.altText: Mansfield farmers market under the trees
Mansfield farmers market under the trees
Open for business at the Mansfield Farmers Market
Open for business at the Mansfield Farmers Market
Fresh fruit and vegetables at the mansfield farmers market
Fresh fruit and vegetables at the mansfield farmers market
Fresh fruit and produce at the mansfield farmers market
Fresh fruit and produce at the mansfield farmers market

item.title: Pfeiffer Wines Autumn Farmers Market 2014
item.description:
As the first leaves change colour and the nights turn cooler, it is clear that Autumn is upon us. What better way to celebrate this new season than to stock up the pantry with a delicious assortment of autumnal produce?
With seasonal staples, gourmet indulgences, Autumn fruits and vegetables, hot food and great coffee available, it is the perfect excuse to join us and celebrate all things Autumn within our picturesque winery grounds, surrounded by the beautiful colours of Autumn. There will be hot food and fresh coffee all day and of course all of our award winning Pfeiffer wines will be available for tasting and sales.

item.title: Pfeiffer Wines Summer Farmers Market 2014
item.description:
Summer heralds a bounty of seasonal produce, from fresh strawberries and vibrant, colourful vegetables to juicy apricots and deliciously fragrant peaches. To celebrate the return of Summer Pfeiffer Wines invites you to our Summer Farmers Market.
Pfeiffer Wines will have hot food, live music and good coffee, and of course and array of the freshest Summer produce available, from plump tomatoes to new season nectarines, specialty cheese to home made pasta, verjuice to artisan breads.
There will be hot food and fresh coffee all day and of course all of our award winning Pfeiffer wines will be available for tasting and sales.

item.title: Castlemaine Artists Market
item.description:
The Castlemaine Artists Market trades on the first Sunday of each month, excluding January.
The Castlemaine Artists Market is based on a strong commitment to things that are individually handmade and objects of beauty or artistic intent made with skill and care.
Located in the picturesque brickyard gardens of the historic Theatre Royal in the heart of Castlemaine, the artists market is a wonderful place to explore that wealth of talent found in the Castlemaine region.
1st Sunday of the month, 10am - 3pm

item.title: RACV Australia Day Picnic and Vehicle Display
item.description:
Celebrate Australia Day in the Kings Domain where there will be a host of activities, food stalls and entertainment, including working dog displays, soccer, tai chi and mini-golf. There will also be more than 450 veteran, vintage and classic vehicles on show at the annual RACV Federation Vehicle display.
There will be a 21-gun salute at the Shrine of Remembrance at midday and the Royal Australian Air Force's elite aerobatic team will entertain crowds with their aerial flyover and display (subject to weather conditions). At 2pm there will be birthday celebrations for the 1000 Victorians who where born on Australia Day, so you can sing along with James Morrison and his band, plus there'll be free concerts in the Sidney Myer Music Bowl.
Supported by RACV in conjunction with the Federation of Veteran, Vintage and Classic Vehicle Clubs.

item.title: Australia Day Flag Raising Ceremony
item.description:
Come to the official flag raising ceremony as part of the Australia Day celebrations. His Excellency, the Honourable Alex Chernov, AC QC, Governor of Victoria officiates as the National Flag is raised at 10:30am.
The Governor will inspect the Tri-Service Royal Guard of Honour and the Premier of Victoria will lead the public in the Australia Day Affirmation.
Supported by the City of Melbourne.

item.title: Mildura City Market
item.description:
Find a gift among the many stalls that have lovely items for sale at the Mildura City Market.
There are crafts, socks, clothing, home cooking, fruit and vegetables as well as jams, honey, pickles and dried fruit. You will also find jewellery, natural beauty products, books, plants, fancy cards, woodwork items, bric-a-brac and locally made boomerangs and didgeridoos.
The market is managed by the Loddon Mallee Region Girl Guides.

item.title: 2014 New Year's Eve Celebration - Rotary Club of Hamilton North
item.description:
The New Year's Eve Street Party is organised by the Rotary Club of Hamilton North for the benefit for young families wishing to celebrate New Years Eve in Hamilton.
Free Entertainment includes jumping castle, slide, train rides, magician and much more...
Alcohol Free Zone. Fireworks will be held in Melville Oval, Lonsdale St.
Lion Club BBQ will be available for hot food and cold drinks.
Time: from 6.00pm Fireworks at 10:30

item.title: Beaufort Market
item.description:
Held in Memorial Park, the Beaufort Market offers a range of goods for sale from produce and plants to second-hand goods and jewellery.
The market also includes a sausage sizzle raising money for local charities. Stay for lunch and see what this great little town has to offer! The market is held on the first Saturday of every month.
item.ns0:organiser: Beaufort Community House and Learning Centre

item.title: Avoca Riverside Market
item.description:
The tranquillity of the venue on the grassy banks of the Avoca River adds to the enjoyment of meandering around the Riverside Market.
Browse more than 40 stalls providing a variety of goods including wine, crafts, fresh food, plants, garden care and clothing.
Held from 9am to 1pm on the fourth Sunday of every month, the November market will also host the very first run of the Pyrenees Historic Vehicle Club, with a most popular car vote being held.

item.title: Classics at Fed Square
item.description:
Enjoy your favourite music all year round with Classics at Fed Square.
Held in the stunning surrounds of the Deakin Edge, these free monthly concerts offer something for everyone, from classical and swing to big band, jazz and even contemporary pop!
The program includes plenty of old favourites from the Melbourne Strings Ensemble to some of the best creative schools across Victoria. Bring a friend and make a day of it, with free exhibitions at ACMI and The Ian Potter Centre: NGV Australia and plenty of great cafes open for lunch or coffee.

item.title: Lunchtime Meditation
item.description:
Escape the stress and busyness of life and discover the peace of meditation for yourself in these free lunchtime classes.
Your guide, Buddhist Monk Gen Dornying, is the resident teacher at Kadampa Meditation Centre Melbourne.
He teaches with a warmth and humility that you will find is naturally inspiring.
Classes are held in The Atrium at Fed Square.

item.title: Health Qigong
item.description:
Exercise your mind, body and soul with free Qigong classes every Friday morning at Fed Square.
Qigong combines integrated physical movement, mental cultivation and regulated breathing. In traditional Chinese medicine the flow of energy, Qi (Chi) along channels in the body is viewed as central to a person's health and wellbeing, with illness being attributed to restricted or blocked Qi flow.
Learn to regulate your Qi with expert instructors from Tai Chi Australia. You can also join instructors from Tai Chi Australia every Tuesday for free Tai Chi classes at Fed Square.
Suitable for all ages and all fitness levels.

item.title: Mansfield District Hospital Carols By Candlelight
item.description: Celebrate the magic of Christmas with song and gather in the tranquil gardens of the Mansfield District Hospital from 7pm and enjoy this very special evening. There will be Christmas gift stalls, glow candles, cold drinks and a sausage sizzle. Carols will begin at 8pm and everyone is welcome. Bring the picnic rug or chair and enjoy this wonderful evening with family and friends. All monies raised goes towards our wonderful hospital.

item.title: Hamilton Wool and Craft Guild
item.description:
The Hamilton Wool and Craft Guild meets every second Monday of each month, excluding the months of December and January, where you can come along and join in with craft including spinning, weaving and felting.
10.30am
All visitors and new members are most welcome to attend.
Please phone prior to confirm your attendance and to answer any questions.

item.title: ISAF Sailing World Cup
item.description:
The official opening for the 2014 ISAF Sailing World Cup - Melbourne will see Chairman Bruce Griffiths welcome competing Olympic athletes and all Invited Classes to the regatta on the first day of the event. The opening ceremony taking place on the balcony of the yacht club will host the official competitor briefing and the all-important flag raising, signalling the event has commenced.
The function coincides with Sail Melbourne's School's Team Racing competition showcasing hundreds of schoolchildren battling it out on the bay, who will then have the incredible chance to meet their Olympic sailing heroes face-to-face.

item.title: Yarraville Festival
item.description: Celebrating its 33rd birthday, the Yarraville Festival boasts local performers, market stalls and art exhibitions for a family-friendly day that brings the unique and quaint Yarraville Village to life. A kids film festival held at the Sun Theatre will be screened on Festival day and a Teddy Bear picnic for the toddlers, free yoga classes, dance workshops and 7 stages of great music!

item.title: Australia Day in Melbourne
item.description: Join in the myriad of celebrations taking place in Melbourne's city centre on Australia Day including the Official Flag Raising Ceremony, the Australia Day March, events in St Kilda Road, Queen Victoria Gardens and Kings Domain Gardens, at the National Gallery of Victoria and conclude the day with celebrations and a spectacular fireworks display at Docklands.

item.title: Kilcunda Lobster Festival
item.description:
Join the Annual Kilcunda Lobster Festival at the Kilcunda foreshore car park for the 31st year of this family friendly event.
The festival runs from 9am to 4pm or until all lobsters are sold. Live music all day, monster raffle, carnival rides and amusements, emergency service displays. Lobster sales and lunches, Chance your luck on the Lobster Spinning Wheel all day or in the monster raffle drawn at 3pm. Hot food and drinks available and loads of market stalls.
A great day for the family down on the coast at Kilcunda. All proceeds to the Kilcunda and local communities. Foreshore car park, Bass Highway, Kilcunda.
All details can be found on the Kilcunda Community Development Association website.

item.title: Nareen Produce Swap
item.description:
The Nareen Produce Swap is open to anyone who grows their own produce to come along and swap produce for something you don't have in your own garden.
No money changes hands making it a very cost effective way for people to obtain fresh fruit and vegetables.
Don't worry if you haven't got a lot to swap, bring along recopies, jams, flowers and much more.
The Produce Swap is held the last Sunday of each month 10am to 11.30am

item.title: Millionaire Hot Seat Studio Audience
item.description:
Come along to a taping of 'Millionaire Hot Seat' and enjoy all the fun of being part of a studio audience. It's a great day out with family and friends to see Australia's favorite game show come to life.
Audience members can be winners too, receiving 20% off entry to the magical Melbourne Star wheel, as well as other Harbor Town discounts.
And when you come along you're also entered into the draw to win tickets to a taping of The Footy Show and $500 cash.
Recording dates are Monday 28 July and Tuesday 29 July.

item.title: Car Club Showcase
item.description:
See your favourite cars up close and meet the proud owners at the Federation Square car club showcase series.
On the last Sunday of every month, car aficionados transform the Flinders Street frontage of Federation Square into the most glamorous car park in town.
Classic cars one month, vintage the next and modern sports cars another. See them all lovingly restored.
From vintage classics to V8 Commodores, this will surprise and delight even the biggest car enthusiast.
On the last Sunday of each month.

item.title: MCG Open Day
item.description:
On Sunday September 28, the day after the 2014 AFL Grand Final, the MCG will be open for everyone to enjoy.
MCG Open Day is a free event, allowing sports fans to gain rare access to the hallowed turf of the MCG and have a kick-to-kick with family and friends.
There will also be an opportunity to access parts of the stadium that are normally off limits, like the player change rooms and the cricket viewing rooms.
Highlights of the day include: · Relive your favourite sporting moments on the hallowed turf of the MCG with kick-to-kick with family and friends. · Explore the inner sanctum of the MCG, including the player change rooms and cricket viewing rooms. · Visit the National Sports Museum (cost $5). · Have your photo taken on the AFL premiership dais with the 2014 replica premiership cup (cost $10). · Roving entertainment and activities.
Open Day will take place from 10am to 3pm with last ground access at 2.30pm. Access to the MCG will available via Gate 3 (National Sports Museum entrance).

item.title: Australia Day Celebrations Mansfield
item.description:
Bring the family along and celebrate Australia Day in Mansfield.
A fabulous community celebration including a sausage sizzle and live entertainment from 8.30am on the High Street median strip in Mansfield.
Guest speakers will present before the commencement of the Flag Raising Ceremony and presentation of the Mansfield Australia Day Awards.

item.title: Bonnie Doon Country Market & Car Boot Sale
item.description:
The Bonnie Doon Country Market and Car Boot Sales is a delightful country market. Old deciduous trees and the charming atmosphere of country living, invite you to linger at the popular market.
It's held at the Bonnie Doon Community Centre between 8.30am and 1pm and offers a variety of market stalls, including food and great coffee. Come along for breakfast and stay for lunch!
The market is held on a Sunday five times a year, Australia Day Weekend, Easter Sunday, Queen's Birthday weekend, last weekend in September school holidays and Melbourne Cup weekend.

item.title: Spirit of the Square
item.description:
Merriment, music, films, video games, family portraits and secret picnic places – Fed Square does Christmas a little bit differently!
