With its array of family-friendly events and activities, Fed Square’s free Christmas program, Spirit of the Square is one of Melbourne’s great December traditions.
For the month of December, Fed Square is taken over by a large public art installation of more than 100 Christmas trees by urban artists, The Projects. See the trees transform each week creating quirky patterns, mazes and secret hiding spaces.
Listen to community choirs singing your favourite festive songs daily.
Play independent video games on the Big Screen every Monday afternoon with the team from Freeplay Independent Gaming Festival.
Watch classic Christmas films as well as block-buster movies on the Big Screen.
Find a sunny spot in the Square and soak up tunes from some of Melbourne’s best musicians with free acoustic music sets on the stage every Thursday evening.
Take a quirky photo of you and the family among the trees with free family portrait services every weekend thanks to The Projects.
Browse through a Christmas food market that includes festive offerings from Fed Square’s many restaurants and cafes.
For those who find themselves orphaned on Christmas Day, come to Fed Square for a Christmas movie marathon. Bring your own picnic basket and find a spot among the installation of more than 100 Christmas trees and celebrate the day with fellow Christmas exiles.
Visit website for times and dates of music nights, films, choirs, family portraits and the Christmas Market.

item.title: Australia Day 2015
item.description:
Australia Day ceremonies occurring across the Shire include flag raising, guest speakers, presentations, entertainment and community barbecues. Members of the public can attend the Southern Grampians Shire Council Australia Day Celebrations to be held on Sunday 26th January 2015, at the Hamilton Botanic Gardens.
The official program will commence at 10.30am with presentations of Australia Day Awards, Address from Australia Day Ambassador, flag raising, Citizenship Ceremony and musical items. A free barbecue will be provided by the Hamilton Lions Club at the conclusion of the function.
Other celebrations will be taking place across the Shire.

item.title: Hamilton Country Fair 2014
item.description:
Gray Street Primary school invites you to their Country Fair this spring.
Featuring the Great Victorian Jam & Chutney Challenge, homemade food stalls, 30 undercover stalls, kids rides, amusements, show bags, an animal farm, car displays, a haunted house, live music, fairy floss, kid's activities, books, plants, preserves, toys and so much more.
Time: 11am - 4.00pm

image.altText: Gray Street Primary School Country Fair
Gray Street Primary School Country Fair

item.title: 2014 Penshurst Christmas Market
item.description:
Penshurst is set at the base of Mount Rouse in Western Victoria, in a region rich on Volcanic history 30kms from Hamilton.
Looking for last minute Christmas presents, or something special for someone special...
Shop for Christmas at the Penshurst Christmas Market. There is sure to be something for everyone!
New stall holders welcome.
Time: 6.00pm - 9.00pm

item.title: Mansfield High Country Festival Grand Parade
item.description: The Rotary Grand Parade is a family affair. Favourites like bagpipes, clowns, horses and an amazing display of ingeniously designed floats will add to the carnival atmosphere of a town transformed and in Festival mode. This is a true community event with over 300 people participating. See Mansfield dress up, show off and parade along High Street.

item.title: Pako Festa A Celebration of Cultural Diversity
item.description:
Pako Festa, now in its thirty-second year, is Geelong's much loved, award-winning, free annual community cultural festival - the biggest of its kind in Australia.
Managed by Diversitat and held on the last weekend of February in Pakington Street, Geelong West, "the multicultural heart of Geelong", it incorporates an extravagant street parade featuring around ninety floats and hundreds of performers representing forty-five affiliated ethnic communities and around sixty other community groups and organisations.
The street is lined with stalls selling traditional foods and arts and crafts, and nine separate stages in the precinct offer performances of music and dance as well as interactive workshops and exhibitions. Pako Festa has become one of Victoria's premier multicultural event, attended by well over 100,000 people in each of the last three years
Visit the website for full program and to download the Pako Festa event application.

item.title: Mansfield Bush Market
item.description:
Mansfield Bushmarket is a must do whilst in visiting!
One of the largest and most popular Bush markets offering just about everything you could imagine.
Local produce such as fresh breads, cakes, fruit & vegetables, nuts, seeds, jams, preserves & olives just to mention a few.
There will be a number of local wines for tasting & purchase, art & craft, plants, clothing, gifts and much more. There will be numerous food and refreshment options available.

item.title: Makers Market Abbotsford
item.description:
The Abbotsford Makers Market is a not for profit association supporting and showcasing the diversity and excellence of local artisans and crafters.
All items are handmade original designs and include photography, textiles, print, wood, ceramic, jewellery, sculpture, paper, glass, clothing, toys, home decor and more. Food stalls are also a regular addition to the market with cupcakes, biscuits, fudge and much more available to nibble on!
The market is held indoors on the third Sunday of every month in the main Convent building at the Abbotsford Convent.
The Convent is an exciting arts precinct situated by the Yarra and the Collingwood Children's Farm. Surrounded by beautiful gardens, the Convent's historic buildings are full of studios, galleries, meeting and workshop spaces plus a choice of excellent eating places.

item.title: Naturally Loddon - Wedderburn Naturally New Age Festival and Farmers Market
item.description:
The Wedderburn Naturally New Age Festival and Farmers Market have a diverse range of stalls this year; jewellery, crystals, clairvoyant readings, palm readings, astrology, handmade products, soap, sculpture, Shamanic healing, crystal balancing, Reiki, a variety of baked goods, hot and cold foods and much, much more.
This year they have aimed to bring a real family, kid friendly atmosphere to this event as well as catering for grown up spiritual seeking.
The kid's entertainment includes a covered, supervised jumping castle, Red the Clown, who will perform magic acts, balloon art and other acts to entertain the whole family. Our face painter will turn your kids into butterfly's, tigers or whatever they want, for a small fee.
Musicians will rove, providing musical accompaniment to the delicious food that will be available. Lamine Sonko, African Culture Keeper and his African band will entertain us all and include us with drum and dancing workshops. Other workshops will be announced on the day.
The Wedderburn Naturally New Age Festival and Farmers Market are looking forward to an extremely successful festival again and in conjunction with our inaugural Farmers Markets, the place should be really rocking.
Wedderburn Lions Club are providing a barbecue.

item.title: Trouble is my Business
item.description:
Tracing the very first time forensic techniques such as blood pattern analysis were used by maverick detectives in the 1920s to the creation of specialist crime squads, this exhibition reveals the details and diversity of work carried out by detectives.
Discover what makes a detective unique, find out who the Shadow Squad were, see forensic evidence from real cases and learn how detectives of the future will solve crimes.

item.title: Flashpoint theatre at the Library
item.description:
Listen to rehearsed excerpts from winning scripts from the 2013 R E Ross Trust Playwrights' Script Development Awards.
The evening will feature the following readings:
Mari Lourey: Dirt Cloud Didem Caia: Vile Merrilee Moss: Oriel
After the readings there will be an 'in conversation' with the three playwrights, moderated by the artistic director of Playwriting Australia, Tim Roseman, followed by an opportunity for an audience Q&A.

item.title: Coal Creek Pirates Day
item.description:
Looking for something to do during the school holidays or just enjoy dressing up, then Coal Creek has another fun-packed day for the family!
Enjoy a treasure hunt for all pirate, magic and balloon show, boat races at the lake - buy and decorate your boat, then enter your boat at the lake to see if your pirate ship wins the race and competitions for the best dressed pirate.
As part of the annual Pirates Day celebrations at Coal Creek, Gippsland Gamers will be running the following amazing stuff: In the middle of the Seas of Skullduggery - Skeleton Island, hiding place of Cap'n Rumblebelly's buried treasure! Around the outside of the sea, the islands of six pirate kings desperate to get their hands on the treasure! Take command of one of the pirate's ships and try to get to Skeleton Island first to dig up the treasure, and then get it back to your own island to claim it forever! But beware, five other pirates have the same idea as you, and even if you get the treasure, you might not be able to hang onto it!
Pirates Treasure is an exciting game of skill for young children. Using toy pirate ships, batons and thrown dice for cannon balls, the game is both fast and fun! Cap'n Rumblebelly's fabulous buried horde of chocolate money is at stake - may the best buccaneer win!
item.ns0:organiser: Coal Creek Community Park and Museum

item.title: The Australian Pedal Car Grand Prix 2014
item.description:
The Australian Pedal Car Grand Prix is a community event, to raise funds for local charities and The Victoria Police Blue Ribbon Foundation.
A fun, healthy, environmentally friendly event, which sends competitors racing around the streets of Coleraine, in the picturesque Western District of Victoria.
Teams are invited to build and race their own unique Pedal car in a two hour endurance event.
Time:12noon - 6.00pm

image.altText: The Australian Pedal Car Grand Prix
The Australian Pedal Car Grand Prix

item.title: Diwali Indian Festival of Light
item.description:
Experience the charms of Indian culture at the Diwali Festival of Light 2014 at Fed Square.
Each year, Fed Square comes to life with diverse stalls and activities exploring the different traditions, cuisines and crafts of India.
Savour the tastes of authentic Indian food with an array of food stalls, admire delicate hand-made Indian jewellery and fine fashion and unwind with a great range of Indian cinema and music. There will also be demonstrations of traditional Henna painting and classical Indian and Bollywood dance performances and workshops.
While Diwali is commonly referred to as the 'festival of lights', for Hindus it is actually about celebrating inner light and the belief that good will triumph over evil.
Don't miss this beautiful festival renowned for its brilliant displays of fireworks and hundreds of glittering lamps to light up the 'darkness'.

item.title: Vietnamese Children's Lantern Festival
item.description:
Be part of the celebrations as Fed Square comes alive for the Vietnamese Children's Lantern Festival.
The Vietnamese Lantern Festival is a widely celebrated cultural event in Vietnam which brings families together to celebrate the full moon with dancing, singing, storytelling, a lantern parade and children's lantern-making workshops.
The Lantern Festival coincides with the Mid-Autumn Festival, which is a popular East Asian celebration dating back over 3,000 years to China's Zhou Dynasty. In Malaysia and Singapore it is also referred to as the Moon or Mooncake Festival.
There are many traditional activities that make up the celebrations including, eating moon cakes under the moon, carrying brightly-lit lanterns, burning incense, planting trees, collecting dandelion leaves sharing them with family members and Fire Dragon dances.
Join this multicultural feast as the sun rests for the day and the moon rises.

item.title: Mission Mexican Festival
item.description:
Join the colourful fiesta Mission Mexican Festival at Fed Square for Mexican Independence Day!
This year's Mexican Festival has your Sunday wrapped up like a soft shell taco as Fed Square is filled with the flavours, sounds and experiences of Mexico.
Get your dose of 'Vitamin T' - that's Tacos, Tamales, Tortas, Tostadas and more traditional dishes from the Mexican food stalls along River Terrace. Enjoy performances on the Viva Mexico Stage including local Mexican musicians, folk dance groups, mariachis, Zumba dancing, live Salsa band LA 45 and more.
Indulge in a drink or two at the Mexican bar, explore a market with handcrafts and jewellery or head inside The Atrium to browse the Mexican artwork display. There's also dedicated entertainment for the kids at a Kids' Corner with music, singing, piñata making and painting.
Bring your amigos and join this spectacular celebration of Mexican culture.

item.title: Maldon Market: Handmade, Home grown
item.description:
The new Maldon Market is a monthly growers and makers market that brings together the very best hand made products and hand grown produce from the creative and fertile heart of Victoria, as well as emerging Melbourne talent.
From soap to soup, fruit to furniture, plants to pants, jewellery to jumpers, the Maldon Market has something for everyone.
The market will feature: gourmet take away food and great coffee; live music; kids entertainment and playground; beautiful gardens to relax in; historic township to explore; hand made arts, crafts, jewellery, clothes, home grown fruit, vegetables, plants and other produce.

ns0:venue.name: Historic township of Maldon, Central Vic

item.title: Tolmie Craft & Farmers Market
item.description:
Take a scenic and relaxing drive out to Tolmie for their monthly Craft and Farmers Market.
Enjoy great coffee and breaky! Purchase locally grown produce and locally made products at the Tolmie Recreation Reserve, approximately 20 minutes drive from Mansfield.
The market is held on the third Saturday of each month during Spring Summer and Autumn.
For Stall holder enquiries please call Marg on 03 5776 2231.
Tolmie looks forward to welcoming you.

item.title: Wangaratta Performing Arts Centre 4th Birthday Celebration
item.description:
The format of the evening will include a live broadcast on OAK FM in the forecourt of the Performing Arts Centre, appearances by Creative Youth providing music, a sausage sizzle supplied by one of the local service groups and balloon give aways.
Live to air interviews will take place with the radio announcer and will be sourced from community groups who have used the venue, special appearances by In The Mood performers and other local identities.

item.title: Yarra Valley Open Studios
item.description:
For a single weekend this spring, you are invited to experience the people, space, making process and ideas that unfold within the private studios of artists in the delightful Yarra Valley.
The 2014 program includes heaps of inspiring studios and a group exhibition at the Memo in Healesville.
Please see website for full program details.

ns0:venue.name: Yarra Valley Open Studios Group Exhibition

item.title: Oxley Bush Market
item.description:
Staged at the historic Oxley Shire Hall (1875), the annual Oxley Bush market is timed to coincide with the Wangaratta Festival of Jazz and Blues.
Thousands of visitors flock to Oxley for this annual event and wander among the 165 stalls boasting a variety of home-made, home-produced, home-grown and new items. Widely regarded as the premier bush market in country Victoria, the event attracts stallholders from throughout the North East, as well as all corners of Victoria and southern New South Wales. Over and above the enormous range of high quality goods on sale, visitors will be delighted by the variety of gourmet food on offer, the buskers, the rides and just the sheer activity and vibrancy of the event.
The Oxley market is also valued for the contribution it makes to many local fundraising groups, including schools, kindergartens, service clubs, fire brigades, the Cancer Council and the Royal Children's Hospital Auxiliary.
No dogs allowed.

item.title: Bonjour Bright
item.description:
Enjoy the French influenced festival in Howitt Park, Bright with open air films, live music, food and wine as an accompaniment to the Audax Alpine Classic. There is plenty of kids entertainment on offer throughout the weekend and a range of artists and musicians.
Free admission.
More information released closer to the event.

item.title: Targa High Country
item.description:
This action-packed, adrenaline-filled tarmac rally is second only to the iconic Targa Tasmania. More than 200 performance cars, muscle cars and classics head to Mansfield-Mt Buller to compete over 16 high-octane stages, starting with the Mansfield street stage on Friday evening. Head into town to watch Mustangs, Lamborghinis, Porsches, souped-up street cars and old classics gunning it down the streets and cornering at high speed. Grab a roadside seat at one of Mansfield's cafes and restaurants, and watch the action with a cold beverage in hand. Then enjoy food and entertainment as you get close and personal with the cars and crew at Targa Fest, held after the street stage in Mansfield.
Over the weekend, grab a vantage point and marvel at the skilled Targa drivers as they negotiate the course from Mt Buller to Jamieson, Eildon, King Valley and back to Mt Buller for the spectacular finish.

item.title: Mansfield CWA Produce & Craft Market
item.description: Enjoy an opportunity to purchase fresh produce and some great locally home made goodies with funds going to the Mansfield CWA Group - Wonderful selection of cakes and crafts, produce and preserves with morning tea available. Held 2nd Saturday throughout the year. Located at the CWA Hall in High Street, Mansfield from 10am-2pm

item.title: Point Nepean Portsea Market
item.description:
From the operators of the famous Red Hill Market comes a new quality arts crafts and gourmet food market down by the sea at the Quarantine Station, Point Nepean near Portsea.
Soak in the exceptional atmosphere and regenerate your senses at this delightful market. There is something for everyone from old-world to modern contemporary, a labyrinth of unique treasures worth discovering. No dogs are allowed in the National Park.

item.title: Yarra Glen Racecourse Market
item.description:
Yarra Glen Racecourse Market is a quality arts crafts and gourmet food market.
The Yarra Glen Racecourse Market is returning to its original home on the first Sunday on the month from October to June - 9am to 2pm. Nestled in the heart of the beautiful Yarra Valley is the picturesque Yarra Glen racecourse, home to the Yarra Glen Racecourse Market. Beautiful country vistas, wide walkways, leafy surrounds and ample parking available make this venue the perfect destination for a day out with the family.
Just an hour's drive from Melbourne, the market is a great outdoor shopping experience, perfect for picking some fresh produce or tasting some delicious food and wines. This market held on the first Sunday of every month from October to June. Within this refreshing outdoor environment, you'll need some time to browse the many quality stalls offering only Australian made items. Shoppers can also purchase stylish insulated CMA shopping bags to store their selections.
Whether you're looking for a really different hand made gift, something uniquely beautiful for the home or the freshest gourmet foods and produce, you're bound to find it at our market. And when you are need a break from shopping, there are plenty of home made take away food options to try and ideal picnic spots to rest and enjoy live music and plenty of entertainment for the kids. Make the most of your Yarra Valley visit by adding a stop off at the market for an amazing shopping and dining experience.

item.title: Hanging Rock Market
item.description:
Hanging Rock is a quality arts, crafts and gourmet food market.
Now you can enjoy more than a picnic at Hanging Rock, Craft Markets Australia will host two special craft and produce markets at this well known tourism icon yearly. Visitors can expect to find an excellent variety of both local and regional stalls offering quality Australian made products, delicious gourmet foods and fresh home grown produce.
The Macedon Ranges are less than an hour's drive from Melbourne along the Calder Freeway and only half that time from Melbourne's Tullamarine Airport. Hanging Rock is easily accessed from the A79 Calder Freeway which passes by on the eastern side of Woodend or via Mt Macedon or from the M31 Hume Highway by turning off at Kilmore and travelling through Lancefield, or alternatively from Wallan via Romsey. There's ample parking, great public amenities and easy walking

item.title: Red Hill Community Market
item.description:
Red Hill is the 'grand dame' of Victoria's craft markets.
Soak in the exceptional atmosphere and regenerate your senses at one of the delightful markets. There is something for everyone from old world to modern contemporary, a labyrinth of unique treasures worth discovering. Dedicated commitment to quality brings together over 300 talented stallholders who regularly demonstrate enormous pride in their work by producing original creations of the highest quality. It is a proven feast for the mind, body and soul, a fascinating eclectic mix of textures, materials and colours that make up the vast range of individually designed products.
There is little doubt that on the first Saturday of the month between 8am and 1pm, the Red Hill Community Market is the place to be.

item.title: Flemington Racecourse Market
item.description:
The Flemington Racecourse Market is a quality arts, crafts and gourmet food market. We didn't think it was fair that city people had to travel so far every month to experience the best that the country had to offer, so in 1996 we decided to take the country to the city.
Flemington Racecourse Market provides the best of regional Victorian produce and craft work just around the corner for millions of Melburnians. With the resources of the Flemington Racecourse at our disposal, parking space is never a problem. Join us every month to discover many wonderful treats guaranteed to stimulate your senses!

item.title: Mornington Racecourse Market
item.description:
Mornington Racecourse Market is a quality arts crafts and gourmet food market.
Mornington is one of the Peninsula's most appealing coastal towns and its famous Racecourse Market has been a monthly highlight since 1994. The well treed site provides shade in summer and protection in the colder months. There is an undercover area as well, but regardless of the weather, thousands of regular market-goers always keep the second Sunday of every month as their 'Mornington day'. When the market is over, the town's boutique shops and coastal pleasures completes a great day's outing.

item.title: Upwelling Festival Portland
item.description:
The Upwelling Festival in Portland offers a fantastic and vibrant way for visitors and Portland locals to celebrate and showcase the unique eco-tourism features of our beautiful coastal town, the Bonney Upwelling.
The Bonney Upwelling is a seven month long natural ocean occurrence where krill form dense swarms up to a kilometre in length. These exceptional feeding conditions trigger a feeding frenzy of whales, seals, giant crabs, tuna, crayfish, squid, fish and seabirds.
The Festival includes the Blessing of the Fleet, Street Parade, Festival markets, local entertainment, Marine Environment Talks, Whale Boat Races along with community art projects on the foreshore.
The Festival is run in conjunction with three other well-established and popular local events - the Rotary Art Show (all weekend) and the Portland Three Bays Marathon (Sunday morning) and the ORCV boat race from Melbourne to Portland (Sunday). Together these events provide a weekend-long program of activities for locals and visitors.

item.title: SpringFest Market Weekend
item.description:
This year's 14th annual Springfest Season of Events remains the Rotary Club of Ballarat's largest fundraising initiative. Events kick off in August with a trivia night, corporate dinner, raffle and harness racing night and culminate in Springfest Market Weekend.
Every year thousands of people flock to Lake Wendouree's foreshore for Market Sunday, with 350 stallholders on show from across Victoria and beyond. Now, with dragon-boat racing, an outrigger canoe regatta and an International Festival on the Saturday, the once one-day event has grown to a two-day festival.

item.title: Benalla Lakeside Craft & Farmers Market
item.description:
Market stalls, food and entertainment for the whole family. Held beside beautiful Lake Benalla on the 4th Saturday of each month.
Come along and browse the great range of stalls, grab a coffee, try and wine and a delicious snack and listen to a diverse range of music performed by local talent.

item.title: 17th Winter Miracles Orchid show
item.description:
The Yarra Valley Orchid Society Plant and Orchid Fair features a variety of Orchids grown by orchid enthusiasts from clubs located in Victoria.
Orchids and plant collectables are available for purchase from the vendors present, including Australian Native and exotic Orchids, Clivias, ferns, bromeliads & plant collectables.
Refreshments are available at nominal prices. Advice is freely available to new or novice growers on the nuances of orchid cultivation and there will be plants for sale.

item.title: Rutherglen Farmers Market
item.description:
Rutherglen Farmers Market has over 25 local and regional producers offering extensive range of fresh produce for sale.
A diverse range of products have been assembled by market organisers that will include; fresh seasonal fruit and vegetables, olive, olive oils, honeys, freshly baked sweets, plants and native flowers and much more.
Once thing is guaranteed that it will be an absolute feast for the taste buds!
Rutherglen Lions Club put on a delicious breakfast of bacon and eggs rolls or a sausage in bread
The Market operates monthly on the second Sunday of every month in the Lions Park, Rutherglen.

item.title: Euroa Village Farmers Market
item.description:
Come along and support the Euroa Village Farmers' Market, proudly presented by the Rotary Club with the support of the Strathbogie Shire Council & the State Government of Victoria.
Proudly accredited with the Victorian Farmers Markets Association, the Euroa Village Farmers' Market was created to enable regional producers to connect regularly with the local community in a vibrant central setting.
The market features around 30 stalls of fresh fruits, vegetables & herbs in season alongside a fantastic selection of meats - boer goat, pork, lamb & beef, honey, free-range eggs, olive products, Strathbogie region wines, nuts, native plants, exotic plants, sweet treats, quality preserves, organic sourdough breads, fresh cut flowers, heirloom seedlings, live poultry (in season), handmade pasta, farmhouse cheeses & much much more! Check out our stallholder list for more information.
Lunch is available; community barbecue, gourmet local sausages - Our Own Premium Meat of Shepparton, wood fired pizza with local ingredients, great coffee, sweet treats from the renowned Ruffy Produce Store and more. Devonshire Teas featuring fabulous local preserves are available from the U3A kitchen, adjacent to the market.
The market has a truly delightful site by The Seven Creeks, complete with the lush melodies of live entertainment from local musicians.
Please bring your bags, baskets and trolleys.
Dogs are welcome on a leash.
See you there!
item.ns0:organiser: Rotary Club of Euroa, Meggs Hannes, Coordinator

item.title: Primrose Fair
item.description:
The Primrose Fair is a shopping paradise and will be held at the historic Cloisters of Toorak College. It will be a spectacular shopping event with 60 stalls located in the cloisters of Toorak College and the Design Pavilion.
The first market on the new year will be held on Saturday, 1 March 2014.
Visit the website for full program details.

item.title: Australian Mounted Games Association
item.description:
Held at Wentworth Showgrounds, Mounted Games are a series of very fast races, exciting for participants and spectators alike, performed by people on ponies.
They require a high degree of athletic ability, good riding skills, hand-to-eye coordination, general determination to see things through to the end no matter what, and a competitive spirit which nevertheless requires an ability to work together with other riders and to be willing to help one another.
The Mounted Games community is a large family! As such, there is healthy good-natured rivalry on the field of play, but great cooperation between players off the field regarding matters of the games as well as those of personal relationships and logistics.
Mounted Games were the inspiration of H.R.H. Prince Philip. When Col. Sir Mike Ansell was Director of the Horse of the Year Show, Prince Philip asked if he could devise a competition for children who could not afford an expensive, well-bred pony, and in 1957 the Horse of the Year Show, then at Harringay Arena, staged the first Mounted Games Championship for the Prince Philip Cup - it was an immediate box office success.

item.title: Wentworth Rotary Country Music Main Street Market
item.description:
In conjunction with the Mildura Country Music Festival, Wentworth's, Darling Street will be a hive of activity.
The main street will be lined with various market stalls open for business with a variety of foods and crafts.
Country music will be performed live for your entertainment by many artists between 10am and 1pm.
Bring a chair and enjoy the atmosphere.

item.title: Luna 1878 Winter Night Market
item.description:
Melbourne in August might be famed more for footy and freezing weather than fabulous free, al fresco events, but get set for an event that brings new life to the dead of winter.
Cocooned within the historic sheds of Queen Victoria Market, the new night market event is a sensory overload featuring some of Melbourne's best independent performers, designers, artists, chefs, winemakers and foodies.
Held on Wednesday evenings throughout July and August, Luna 1878 has become a become a new winter ritual, where visitors can embrace some of the city's craftiest talent coming together for the first time at the iconic 'Vic Market'.
Be entranced by performance, where a whimsical sense of fun awaits. And, yes, it will be cosy. There will heaters to gather around, mulled wine and exotic yet hearty food.
You will be tantalised by the delicious food offerings which will include Eastern European traditional foods like borsht and pierogi (dumplings), Nepalese lamb shank stews and goat curries, South American casseroles, Sicilian fisherman stews and Italian BBQ spatchcock.
There'll also be dozens of wines available for tasting, including a steaming array of hot drinks to complement the rolling line up of performance artists and live music that will change each week.

item.title: Milawa Gourmet Region Producers Market
item.description:
Milawa Gourmet Region have a producers market at the beginning of each season. The market showcases the beautiful produce produced in North East Victoria which a chance for the public to meet the producers.
The market also features live music and craft items.
It's a great day out for the family, so come down to the next market and see what great produce you can find.

item.title: Moyhu Farmers & Community Market
item.description:
Celebrating the best of the King Valley's Produce and its vibrant community, the Moyhu Farmers and Community Market is a fantastic event for the locals and visitors alike.
Browse the stalls for espresso coffee, hot farmers breakfast, plants, fresh local fruit and vegetables, handmade preserves and jams, bread, local meat producers, seasonal produce and more.

item.title: Sunraysia Farmers Market
item.description:
Sunraysia Farmers Market provides the platform that links good food direct from the regions genuine producers with community.
Indulge the senses, taste, wander and unwind as you discover a range of superb fresh fruit, vegetables and herbs; freshly brewed coffee, wine, olive oil, preserves and condiments; eggs, honey, grains and nuts; freshly baked bread, pastries and cakes plus meat and smallgoods and so much more.
Take the time to enjoy breakfast made from the market's produce under the giant river gums beside the Murray River. There is plenty of parking, pathways and flat ground and with the playgrounds nearby, it's perfect for families.
Sunraysia Farmers Market is temporarily at Jaycee Park, Hugh King Drive Mildura until redevelopment of Ornamental Lakes, Hugh King Drive Mildura is complete.

item.title: Tai Chi at Fed Square
item.description:
Start each week feeling refreshed, rejuvenated and energised with Tai Chi, the Chinese martial art that promotes health and relaxation.
Join expert instructors from Tai Chi Australia for a free class every Tuesday morning in the heart of Melbourne city - Fed Square.
Exercise your mind, body and soul in this inspiring location.

item.title: Scots Day Out
item.description:
Held at Rosalind Park in Bendigo, the Scots Day Out will be a day filled with fun.
Activities on the day include:
- Colourful parade down View St to Rosalind Park, Pipe bands (bands from across the state will be part of the Victorian Highland Pipe Band Association competition, the first band contest for 2013) - Highland dancers will compete in the inaugural Central Victoria Highland Dancing Classic - A warm-up for the Australian Commonwealth Championships - Scottish country dancers from Bendigo and central Victoria will give displays throughout the day - Emu Creek Bush Band will play Celtic folk music throughout the day - Clans will set up tents with displays on Scottish family history - Stalls selling Scottish goods and offering haggis and whisky tastings - Scottish story telling for families - Swordplay - A spectacular finale at 4.30pm featuring Scots Day Out participants

item.title: Bright Spring Festival
item.description:
The Bright Spring Festival showcases what the Bright & Surrounds is all about; great cafes and restaurants, access to many wineries, accommodation to suit all budgets, adventure sports, walking tracks and trails, street and river markets, art exhibitions and the natural beauty of the Ovens and Kiewa Valleys, not found elsewhere in Victoria.
Events include: -Workshops and classes -Open garden displays -Myrtleford Agricultural and Pastoral Show -Oktoberfest -Spring garden feast -Grand firework spectacular and concert -Monster Rotary market

item.title: Piers Festival
item.description:
The Piers Festival will bring the Port Melbourne piers precinct to life with a spectacular display of music, dance, markets, exhibitions, forums and more. This colourful celebration of Melbourne's diversity will link in with Victoria's Australia Day activities and highlight the state's rich history of migration.
The event is free, family friendly and will culminate with fireworks.

image.altText: Chinese Lion Dance at Piers Festival
Chinese Lion Dance at Piers Festival
Lamine Sonko and the African Intelligence at Piers Festival
Lamine Sonko and the African Intelligence at Piers Festival
Manasis Greek Dance at Piers Festival
Manasis Greek Dance at Piers Festival

item.title: Beechworth Golden Horseshoes Festival
item.description:
Beechworth comes alive at Easter with a Grand Street Parade, street stalls and entertainment, carnival rides and a massive Easter egg hunt. View the re-enactment of the horse with the golden horseshoes riding into Beechworth.
A weekend packed with activities all weekend with markets, family bike ride and mountain bike racing. There is something to keep everyone entertained this Easter in Beechworth.

item.title: Car Club Showcase
item.description:
See your favourite cars up close and meet the proud owners at the Fed Square Car Club Showcase - a free monthly motor show in the heart of Melbourne.
On the last Sunday of every month car aficionados transform the Flinders Street frontage of Federation Square into the most glamorous car park in town. Classic cars one month, vintage the next and modern sports cars another. All lovingly restored and cared for.

item.title: New Year's Eve at Fed Square
item.description:
On New Year's Eve, Fed Square will beat to the sound of African drums in a free program of live music and dance performances.
Bring the family or meet up with friends for a great night of entertainment by King Marong and Afro Mandinko, Wickid Force Breakers, Chunky Jam and more.
Source: City of Melbourne What's On

item.title: Merbein Street Market
item.description:
The vibrant Merbein Street Market is held on the third Sunday of every month.
On sale you will find crafts, clothing and fresh produce, as well as homemade jams, pickles and dried fruit, jewellery, natural beauty products, books, plants, woodwork items, bric-a-brac and locally made boomerangs and didgeridoos.
The event is managed by Loddon-Mallee Region Girl Guides.

item.title: Cycling Australia Road National Championships
item.description:
Be in Ballarat in early January to witness a world-class field of Australia's greatest cycling starts battle it out for the green and gold Australian jersey at the 2015 Cycling Australia Road National Championships.
The 2015 program will feature three major disciplines - Criterium, Time Trial and Road Race for Men U/23, Elite Women and Elite Men.
The Nationals provide an opportunity to witness four days of high class cycling action. Specifically, the Buninyong road circuit is regarded as one of the top road racing circuits in Australia.

image.altText: King of the Mountain in Buninyong
King of the Mountain in Buninyong

item.title: Fed Square Book Market
item.description:
Love books? Then join Melbourne's bibliophiles at the Fed Square Book Market, one of the largest weekly book markets in Melbourne, in The Atrium at Fed Square.
Each week you can immerse yourself in over 5000 new and pre-loved titles, including literature, history, gardening, travel, art and kids stories.
The Book Market regularly features around fifteen of Melbourne's most experienced book dealers as well as authors and illustrators.

item.title: Melbourne Design Market
item.description:
Why is the Melbourne Design Market so wonderful? It's original, fun, and full of new products that everyone loves to see and buy - and in 2014 the Melbourne Design Market celebrate their 10th anniversary!
Occupying a special place in everyone's diary, the market is now held twice a year in July and November. Thousands of visitors are drawn to its car-park location at Melbourne's Federation Square, transformed for each occasion into a design show that features the latest in fashion, homewares, furniture, lighting and so much more.
There are many recognisable brands at the market; still more make use of the Melbourne Design Market as a launching pad for new enterprises.
Meet the designers, enjoy fine food and coffee, and be part of the Melbourne Design Market's own style in fostering and promoting design.

item.title: Frankston's Christmas Festival of Lights
item.description:
Bring together your family and friends and create your magical family memory at Frankston's Christmas Festival of Lights. Ring in the festive season as Davey Street and the Frankston Arts Centre are transformed into an enchanted land where magic happens and dreams really do come true.
Celebrating its 17th year, Frankston's Christmas Festival of Lights is a wonderful opportunity to bring the family together and celebrate the spirit of community.
Enjoy a night of entertainment, fun and fantasy as you and your family embark on an evening guaranteed to inspire the hearts and imaginations of everyone who attends.
Look for Santa and Mrs Claus as they embark on their journey through the city centre to the festival site, be a part of the parade and excitement of Santa's Grand Arrival and help sing 'Santa Claus is coming to town'.
In Santa's North Pole discover free children's activities, create a Christmas masterpiece or be a part of a traditional nativity scene (bring your camera to capture the moment).
Settle in by the Entertainment Stage for a night set to have you singing along. Be inspired with performances local and national artists.
In Rudolph's Market Place choose from children's clothing, soy candles, macarons, cupcakes, jewellery and more and find the perfect Christmas gift, treat or decoration.
A family tradition, the fireworks and lighting of the 100-year-old Norfolk Pine promises to be a memorable moment. Make sure you and your loved ones don't miss the fireworks display choreographed to an awe-inspiring theatrical sound and light show.

item.title: Alpaca Shearing at Creswick Woollen Mills
item.description:
Alpacas are bred to produce a luxurious fibre like no other. Shearing day is the culmination of weeks of work and months of patiently caring for Alpacas while growing their lustrous fibre. Creswick Woollen Mills is proud to host their 9th annual Alpaca shearing event this September. Alpacas are usually shorn mid to late spring in preparation of the long, hot summers.
It takes great knowledge and skill to shear an Alpaca, so bring the whole family down to experience this memorable occasion together with the breeders, shearers and the Alpacas themselves!
Take the time to enjoy Creswick Woollen Mills newest experience, A Very Fine Yarn and see where the fibre of the alpaca goes after its shorn.

item.title: St. Michael's Annual Cup Day Fair
item.description:
Join in for a fun day for the whole family at St. Michael's Cup Day Fair.
There's a trash and treasure market, cakes and jams, food court, Devonshire teas, arts and crafts, plants, books, silent auction, toys, bouncy castle and much more.
Check out the website for details or call Peter on 0413009413.
Head up to the beautiful Dandenong's and join the St. Michael's Community in celebrating the Melbourne Cup Day holiday.

address.address1: Cnr. Mt. Dandenong Tourist & Falls Roads

item.title: Warragul Arts Market
item.description:
The Warragul Arts Market is held in beautiful Civic Park, where visitors can meet the artists, participate and be entertained by local performers, purchase unique creations and be inspired!
Artist run stalls and demonstrating artists, enjoy live music and even participate in free hands on creative arts activities.
The market runs on the third Saturday of the month, from October to March only and is held on the same day and location as the Warragul Farmers Market.

item.title: Daylesford Macedon Ranges Open Studios
item.description:
Thirty-five artists from the beautiful Daylesford and Macedon Ranges region will open their studios for six days in November, giving the public a chance to go 'behind the scenes' of the creative process, meet the artists in their creative spaces, and learn about their work and inspiration.
The Daylesford and Macedon Ranges Open Studios is based on the famous Cambridge Open Studios event, and will showcase some of its extraordinary artists. Visit the Group Exhibition in the historic St Pauls' Church Hall to preview the artist's work before calling at their studios in the little towns and villages across the region, such as Gisborne, Mt Macedon, Newham, Woodend, Kyneton, Malmsbury, Trentham, Glen Lyon, Wheatsheaf, Lyonville, Musk, Daylesford, Hepburn Springs, Basalt and Yandoit. Each of these artists work is nurtured and inspired by the region in which they live and work, such as Ashika Ostapkowicz's granite "Creation" shown in the picture above.
The Daylesford and Macedon Ranges Open Studios event takes you to into the heart of the environment of the Daylesford and Macedon Ranges, known for its excellent food, wine and produce, a landscape of continuous inspiration to its thriving cultural community.

image.altText: From Here to Eternity sculpture by Ashika
From Here to Eternity sculpture by Ashika
Painting by Trentham Artist Rose Wilson
Painting by Trentham Artist Rose Wilson

item.title: Melbourne Cup - Superdog Series
item.description:
The Melbourne Cup - Superdog Series is the richest greyhound race in the world, carrying $500,000 in prize money. Run over Sandown's famous 515m distance, the Melbourne Cup - Superdog Series brings together the fastest greyhounds from across Australasia competing for a $350,000 first prize.
This event is the final event in the Superdogs series, a three week greyhound racing extravaganza featuring four group races and more than $1million in prize money.

image.altText: The mighty Dyna Tron wins the Melbourne Cup
The mighty Dyna Tron wins the Melbourne Cup

item.title: Pets' Day Out
item.description:
Treat yourself, your pet and your whole family to the pet event of the year. Pets' Day Out 2014 promises to be an exciting day of entertainment and information ranging from Pet parades, competitions, displays, demonstrations, interactive events and children's activities.
All dogs must be inoculated and on a leash. Other pets must me securely contained.
This is a free event. Animals actions are the responsibility of their owner.
For further enquiries on Pets' Day Out, please phone Frankston City Council or stay tuned to the Frankston Events Facebook page.

image.altText: Frankston City Mayor, Cr Brian Cunial and his dog Max
Frankston City Mayor, Cr Brian Cunial and his dog Max

item.title: Camperdown Craft Market
item.description:
Held on the historic avenue of Camperdown's Manifold Street, the Camperdown Craft Market is held on the first Sunday of each month. The market offers opportunity to browse and buy home produced goods including cakes, produce, plants, clothing and novelties.
Top this off with the opportunity to climb the Gothic style clock tower to inspect the clock mechanism and enjoy the panoramic views of our historic town before heading to the heritage centre to learn more about the area and its fascinating history.

item.title: Surrey Hills Music Festival
item.description:
The Surrey Hills Music Festival was established in 2010 and features a large variety of acts from soloists to choirs, offering food and refreshment, workshops and demonstrations. The 2014 Festival will include even more activities for children and a special program for emerging artists. The festival is the suburb's standout annual community event and its only dedicated music festival embraced by locals and visitors to the area.
Over the past four year, the festival has featured some of Australia's finest musicians and successful bands. A snapshot of recent years includes: distinguished jazz pianist, Tony Gould and cellist Imogen Manins; delightful vocal ensemble Coco's Lunch; successful young band The Tealeaves; talented young singer Sarah Wilkinson, as well as a range of popular festival favourites including hilarious male choir Men in Suits and Melbourne's own crowd-raising The Band Who Knew Too Much.

item.title: Carols By The Creek
item.description:
Join the Pfeiffer 'pfamily' for a 'pfabulous' afternoon of Christmas 'pfestivities'. With lots of your 'pfavourite' Christmas carols to sing along to and 'pfun' kid's activities, this is a "pfree" community event for the whole family.
Bring your own picnic hamper and rug (no bring your own alcohol). Cheese platters, wines by the glass and kids and adult slushies available.

item.title: Metung Farmers Market
item.description:
The Metung Farmers Market is held on the second Saturday of each month. The picturesque Village Green in Metung, overlooking the Gippsland Lakes, is the venue for the market.
From locally grown vegetables and fruit to hand made chocolates and sour dough bread, the Market offers a diverse selection of produce.

item.title: The Light in Winter
item.description:
Experience art, music and performance from dusk with Federation Square's annual winter program, The Light in Winter.
Directed by arts luminary Robyn Archer AO, The Light in Winter brings together local and international artists for a nightly program of free events, performances, exhibitions and the much-loved Solstice Celebration.
Check website closer to the event for full program.

item.title: Winter Blues Festival
item.description:
Forget the winter blues! Echuca Moama's annual Winter Blues Festival is a weekend not to be missed.
The Echuca Moama Winter Blues Festival has become a feature event on the Australian Blues calendar. On the last weekend in July the cream of Australian Blues artists converge of Echuca Moama for a spectacular weekend of music and entertainment in the clubs, hotels, restaurants and streets.
Visitors to this much loved festival can soak up the blues and roots atmosphere from every street corner, restaurants and bars. This year's 15th annual festival was the largest to date with 80+ blues artists filling 50 venues across Echuca Moama. The fact that the vast majority of the blues and roots music is free is still a major drawcard for the festival.
Visit the website all your official Echuca Moama Winter Blues Festival information.

item.title: Benalla & District Classic Car & Motorbike Tour
item.description:
As part 39th Historic Winton weekend activities, join the Benalla & District Classic Car & Motorbike Tour.
The Tour assembles at 9am on Friday 29 May 2015 at the Benalla Art Gallery.
Red plate vehicles welcome.
Proudly supported by the RACV, Benalla Rural City Council and The Austin 7 Club, organisers of Historic Winton.

image.altText: Benalla & District Classic Car & Motorbike Tour 2014
Benalla & District Classic Car & Motorbike Tour 2014
Benalla & District Classic Car & Motorbike Tour 2014
Benalla & District Classic Car & Motorbike Tour 2014
Benalla & District Classic Car & Motorbike Tour 2014

Benalla & District Classic Car & Motorbike Tour 2014
Benalla & District Classic Car & Motorbike Tour 2014
Benalla & District Classic Car & Motorbike Tour
Benalla & District Classic Car & Motorbike Tour

item.title: Frankston Waterfront Festival 2015
item.description:
Over two exciting days, bring family and friends together for a weekend of entertainment, activities, market stalls, food, wine and more at the Frankston Waterfront Festival 2015.
The Frankston Waterfront Festival is the City's annual celebration of its iconic waterfront, award winning beach, bayside location and relaxed lifestyle.
With live music all weekend, families and friends are invited to get involved in all of the activities on offer, from beach and water activities, to enjoying great food, wine, beer and cider or dance in the sunshine. Kids can discover a love for growing their own fruit and vegetables and everyone can take home a treat with market stalls selling art, craft, clothing, treats, preserves and more!
Don't miss the fireworks at 9:45pm on Saturday night.
There is no better way to spend a summer's weekend than by the bay, with good friends, great food and memorable entertainment so make sure you save the date for this annual summer festival.
For more information as it it released visit the website.

item.title: Pfeiffer Wines Art Show
item.description:
The Pfeiffer Wines Art Show celebrates the work of artists who have visited the winery and have painted, drawn, sketched or photographed a distinctive winery scene - be it the natural bush setting, the historic buildings or the century old wooden bridge.
Visitors are also invited to participate in the People's Choice Award by voting for their "pfavourite" artwork whilst at the winery. All original artworks will be for sale.

item.title: Warrnambool Undercover Market
item.description:
Come and explore the original undercover weekly market. Open every Sunday from 8am - 1pm at the Warrnambool Showgrounds, Koroit Street, Warrnambool.
Toys, books, jams, jewellery, cakes, plants, lavender, papers, clothing, craft, fruit and vegies, cut flowers, nostalgic tin signs, candles, crystals, hand knits, Rawleighs products, woodwork, beads, antiques, incense, Body jewellery, soaps and much more.

item.title: Ballan Farmers Market
item.description:
Ballan Farmers' Market, held on the second Saturday of the month in the beautiful grounds of Mill Cottage, Inglis Street Ballan. Ballan sits in stunning volcanic plains amongst a rich food growing community, half way between Bacchus Marsh and Ballarat just one hour from Melbourne by car or train.
Fresh fruit and vegetables, wines, oils, breads and pastries, meat, trees and sweets; from the producer to you.

image.altText: general image of part of the market.
general image of part of the market.

item.title: Meet the Alpacas at Creswick Woollen Mills
item.description:
When school holidays are on, it can be a challenge to find something a little different to keep your kids entertained. Why not bring them to Creswick Woollen Mills to our Alpaca family?
Did you know that Alpacas belong to the same family as camels? These gentle animals communicate by humming and love chasing each other up and down the paddock. They are very inquisitive and enjoy being patted and fed.
Feeding times twice daily at 11am and 2pm. Entry is free and parking available. Alpaca meeting times scheduled twice a day; there is just no reason to miss this event.

item.title: Festival of Sails
item.description:
Welcome to the Festival of Sails.
Since 1844, the Festival of Sails has played a key part in the Victorian and Australian yachting calendar. Highly competitive and diverse, the event caters to all levels of sailing from high performance racing machines to family cruisers.
Evolving over the years, to culminate in its' current format, the Festival of Sails is an iconic and fun-filled event. It offers something that no other regatta in Australia does, combining first-class racing with a brilliant Shoreside Festival, which sees 100,000 visitors flock to the stunning Geelong waterfront to soak up the summer atmosphere.
Visitors to Geelong and local residents come together to celebrate the Australia Day Long Weekend, with an abundance of activity and entertainment. With heaps of live music, art and craft stalls, a regional summer boat show, family friendly activities, free on and off the water come 'n' try activities, Discover Sailing, food and wine stalls, there is something different to experience and enjoy each day.
Whether you are a sailor, or prefer your feet on more solid ground and are looking for a fun way to entertain the family on the Australia Day long weekend, this event provides something for everyone to enjoy.
In January 2015, the Royal Geelong Yacht Club is extremely privileged to be hosting the 2015 International 14 World Championships.
Join them in January for the 172nd Festival of Sails.
For more detailed information, and timing details please visit the event website.

ns0:venue.name: Royal Geelong Yacht Club & Geelong Waterfront

item.title: Arts Centre Melbourne Sunday Market
item.description:
Every Sunday, 10am - 4pm, local artisans fill Arts Centre Melbourne's Lawn to showcase their unique, handmade goods ranging from arts and crafts to freshly made delicacies.
Everything on offer is produced locally, making the market a real favourite for those seeking one-of-a-kind treasures for themselves or as gifts.
Just a short walk over the bridge from Flinders Street Station, the Sunday Market is a much-loved weekly event, with the relaxed feel of a regional craft market set against the backdrop of Melbourne's buzzing arts precinct.
Please note that all stallholders at the Sunday Market rotate positions regularly. If you are looking for your favourites, please be sure to have a wander along St Kilda Rd and behind along the lawn until you can find what you are looking for!

item.title: Fed Square Laughter Club
item.description:
Join in a 30 minute laughter session at Federation Square at 11am on the first and third Sunday of each month.
Laughter Clubs come together for a session and people laugh for no reason without having to resort to jokes or humour. The sessions last about half an hour and are mostly held outdoors. They are run along the lines established by Dr Madan Kataria, who founded the global laughter movement 14 years ago with one club, and there are now over 5,000 clubs worldwide.
Everyone is welcome to experience first-hand the fun of a laughter session, and gain the benefits of laughter, which improves the physical, mental, emotional, spiritual and social health of individuals, workplaces, and society.

item.title: Ararat Farmers Market
item.description:
The Ararat Farmers Market is held on the second Sunday of every month in conjunction with the Ararat Trash and Treasure Market from 9am to 1pm.
Located on the Western Highway at Elizabeth park opposite McDonalds.
Sample the regions finest gourmet produce. If you love good food and wine you'll love coming to our market and enjoying some of finest produce including fruit and vegetables, plants, cheese, honey, wine, organic herbs and breads.
Also enjoy a barbecue.

item.title: Rally Victoria
item.description:
The Australian Rally Championship is set to make a welcome return to Victoria in 2014. The event is the final round of both the 2014 Australian and Victorian Rally Championships.
Grab a spectator Guide from the website and come out to the forest to see Australia's fastest drivers on dirt battle it out to be crowned Australian Rally Champion 2014.
Rally Victoria will be held primarily within the Baw Baw Shire on the popular forest roads around the Noojee - Powelltown district, the event will be based at Lardner Park south of Warragul which is just over 100 kilometres from Melbourne's city centre.
Warragul is easily accessed by the Monash and Princes Freeways.

item.title: RACV Energy Breakthrough - Maryborough
item.description:
The RACV Energy Breakthrough provides an opportunity for students, teachers, parents and local industry to work together to design and construct a vehicle, a machine or innovation in technology that will represent an energy breakthrough.
School groups work throughout the year to design, build and test vehicles or machines within detailed specifications. It requires a team effort and an across-the-curriculum approach. These groups then bring their vehicles and machines to Maryborough, Victoria in November, for a huge celebration in which they can demonstrate and trial them in action.
More than 5,000 student entrants converge on Maryborough, a further 3,000 will work as support crew and another 13,000 will be visitors to the event.
The Energy Expo is amongst the action of the RACV Energy Breakthrough and offers visitors and entrants the chance to relax and enjoy the festive atmosphere. The Energy Expo provides entertainment, fascinating energy efficient displays and opportunities for career advancement.

image.altText: The end of the HPV secondary race

item.title: Moomba Festival
item.description:
Love Melbourne, Love Moomba!
A celebrated part of the Melbourne events calendar for 60 years, Moomba will be back in 2014 with an exciting program of free events and family entertainment, making Melbourne the ideal place to be for the Labour Day long weekend in March.
Held over four days, the festival attracts more than one million visitors to the sun-soaked banks of the Yarra to share in the vibrancy and spirit of our much loved city.
The Carnival runs daily from 11am to 11pm and nightly fireworks on the Yarra start 9.30pm Saturday - Monday.
For full program details visit the Moomba website.

item.title: Yarraville Market
item.description:
Yarraville Markets are a handmade and Australian made craft market situated in the heart of Yarraville Village surrounded by a great selection of cafes, boutique shops and of course the Sun Theatre.
Stallholders are proud to present their products ranging from jewellery, candles, skincare, homewares, herbal teas, clothing, children's accessories, illustrations just to name a few.
The Yarraville Markets experience is warm and family friendly.

item.title: The Summer Night Market
item.description:
The Summer Night Market season is held on Wednesday nights from November until March.
Take a tour of world flavours. Over 35 stalls prepare fresh food on-site from a range of cuisines, including: Indian, Vietnamese, Ethiopian, Spanish, Dutch and Middle Eastern.
The Market will feature fully licensed bars where you can select from a range of Victoria's regional vineyards. Enjoy their best vintages by the glass or bottle on the night or take some home for the cellar.
Enjoy music on the two stages showcasing the best world music and live entertainment Melbourne has to offer!
Explore the stalls of over 200 vendors offering everything from unique clothing and jewellery through to original prints and plants, promising a unusual shopping experience that will have you coming back for more.
An area dedicated to mind, body and spirit - enjoy massage therapists, visit tarot and aura readers, reflexology and iridology practitioners.
Stock the pantry with a selection of Victoria's regional fare. Taste a delightful array of food to take home. Includes wonderful chutneys, mustards, olive oils, fudge and both fresh and dried fruit.

item.title: The Fitzroy Market
item.description:
Fitzroy Market has raised awareness, and funds, for programs helping those in need. This passion for social justice has forged bonds with community partners, helping fund important projects to maintain and strengthen the neighbourhood's support network.
The Fitzroy Market is not driven by a profit motive or trend status, but by the will to create a fun, welcoming atmosphere for all comers, and providing a chance for all members of the richly diverse community to contribute to and gain from the space.
The market consists of 15 car boot stalls, 27 standard stalls, 4 food stalls, a kids craft area, and space for musicians and performers.

item.title: The Great Trentham Spudfest
item.description:
The annual Great Trentham Spudfest is now in its seventh exciting year and all the fun and games will take over the town. This festival is a wonderful way to celebrate the spirit of the community and recognise Trentham's potato-growing heritage.
Once again, the usually shy, humble and bashful potato bursts free from life underground and basks in the limelight for festivities in its honour. The Spudfest is an opportunity for visitors and the local community to join in a number of exciting spud activities and have a spudtastic time. Last year over 4000 people enjoyed the festivities so come along and join us this year - there will be something for everyone!

item.title: Thai Culture and Food Festival
item.description:
Join the Thai community as they celebrate and showcase their rich and historical culture with two days of fun filled with the sights, tastes and sounds of Thailand!!
The 11th Annual Festival was bigger and better than ever before, expanding to a two day event in 2014.
Starting on Saturday 15 March with "Thai Street Culture by the River" on the River Terrace at Federation Square experience Thai Street food and Thai barbecue, Thai massage and products, live music at the Singha Beer Garden and lots of fun and activities.
On Sunday 16 March the Thai Culture and Food Festival began with a traditional blessing by Buddhist monks, and an opening ceremony. Federation Square will be transformed into a haven of Thai culture together with the 'Thai Temple Fun Fair ' showcasing Thai arts, crafts, massage, games and more. Travel and general Information about Thailand and its people was available to answer all your questions!
There was continuous entertainment on stage with performances of Thai dance, Thai kickboxing and Miss Thailand beauty contest, Thai market and Product stalls selling Thai produce.
30 performers direct from Thailand plus local talent. The River Terrace at Fed Square was bedecked with food tents featuring 20 of Melbourne's premier Thai restaurants serving Thai delicacies and highlighting regional food and drink specialities as well as the famous Singha Beer garden and music stage and Muay Thai demonstration performances all afternoon in the Deakin Edge theatre.
The Festival attracted 65,000 people to Federation Square last year - it is a fun-filled family event and it is free!
More details on the 12th anniversary Festival in March 2015 will be posted nearer the time.

item.title: Marysville Farmers Market
item.description:
Come along and enjoy the friendly atmosphere at the Marysville Farmers Market, where you will find something for the whole family. Select from an array of locally produced preserves, jams, chutneys, plants, lavender products, honey, fresh fruit and vegetables and wine.
Held on the fourth Sunday of every month, in the Main Street of Marysville.

item.title: 2014 August Occasion - Agnes Szetey @ Old Post Office Seymour
item.description:
August Occasion is an Annual Art Exhibition held at the C1872 Old Post Office Seymour.
Two world recognised solo artists alternate. Odd years Paul Margocsy and even years Agnes Szetey. Paul is internationally acclaimed for his watercolour/gauche Bird Paintings. Agnes is known for her depictions, in oil, of the Australian bush and heritage.
Openings are held on the first Sunday in August at the Old Post Office Seymour where art and culture, history and heritage, wine and food all combine. An invitation is extended to attend the openings, chat around the open fire and enjoy a complimentary glass of local wine and refreshments.
The Old Post Office Seymour is one of Central Regional Victoria's premier privately owned commercial Fine Art Galleries and was established in 1992. Only one hour from Melbourne, it offers something different, if not unique, that is truly Australian.
A constantly changing group exhibition of paintings by multi-award winning Australian Artists is always on exhibition. The quality of the work is only surpassed by the variety offered. Traditional to contemporary paintings, in all mediums, covering most subjects, are hung as if in your home. Displays of individual quality wildlife sculpture, art glass, jewellery, limited edition prints, woodwork and pottery are tastefully exhibited throughout the multi-roomed Gallery. Since 2012 the Gallery also stocks a selection of Murano Jewellery.
The restaurant, with its open fire, is centrally located. Visitors are welcome to enjoy the relaxed elegant ambience, choose a hearty meal or snack from the extensive menu or just browse with a glass of Goulburn Valley wine in hand. Seymour is a short drive from Nagambie and just 95 kilometres from Melbourne.
The Old Post Office Seymour is home to Louise Barling and Garry Broderick, the owner operators. You are always made welcome at the Old Post Office Seymour.

ns0:venue.name: Old Post Office Seymour Gallery & Restaurant

item.title: Hume Murray Farmers Market
item.description:
Situated at Gateway Village, Wodonga, the popular Hume Murray market has grown from strength to strength.
This market helps support local producers from north east Victoria and southern New South Wales providing a range of fresh seasonal produce and prepared foods. Producers are encouraged to be Victorian Farmers Market Association accredited as the market moves towards full accreditation.
A wonderful variety of produce is on offer including fruit, vegetables, beef, organic lamb and pork, cheeses,eggs, bread, cakes, chocolates, nuts, ice-cream cordials, jams, confectionary, relishes, herbs, wines, oils, olives, honey, flowers, small goods and more.

item.title: Comedy at Spleen
item.description:
Every Monday; Comedy@Spleen is the city's hottest show in town, with a packed room every single week.
With drop-in guests in the past like Jimeoin, Arj Barker, Adam Hills, Wil Anderson, Dave Hughes, Josh Thomas, Charlie Pickering, Claire Hooper and many more. You will never know which special guest you are going to get. They also feature all the hottest young acts in Melbourne that will be household names of tomorrow.
It's always a cracker of a show, and you always have to get in early to snare a seat!

item.title: Murrabit Country Market
item.description:
The Murrabit Country Market is reputedly the largest market in regional Australia. From its small beginnings in 1977, the market has continued to grow. The first Saturday of every month (and Easter Saturday & the third Saturday in December) an astonishing transformation takes place when over 200 stalls open for business. Wares from fresh home grown produce, carefully crafted glass and woodenware, recycled iron, plants, craft, bric-a-brac, hardware and clothing are there to delight the purchaser.
Aromas of freshly cooked barbecues and hot food fill the air and morning tea at the hall, consisting of cappuccinos, scones, sandwiches and sumptuous cakes is not to be missed. Live entertainment adds to the relaxed atmosphere and popular entertainers perform at each of the markets.
After the market, enjoy a two minute drive to the Murray River and try some fishing for the much sought after Murray Cod. Or view the Murrabit bridge, the first all steel bridge to be built over the Murray River between Victoria and New South Wales back in 1926.

item.title: Ballarat Begonia Festival
item.description:
Bring your picnic rug and experience the Ballarat Botanical Gardens in their full glory at the 2014 Ballarat Begonia Festival. A huge program of free garden activities, entertainment, fun for the kids and expert talks will suit all ages and interests.
The Mitchell Harris Wine Garden Immerse yourself in the best of our region's wines in the Mitchell Harris Wine Garden. Get stomping in the winemaking process, or just relax and drink in the vintage atmosphere in the Ballarat Botanical Gardens.
The Tea House Experience the age old ritual of tea within the Festival's exotic garden setting. The Tea House experience offers tea tastings with Chat for Tea as well as insights into the ceremony of tea appreciation.
The popular Woodworking Shed will entertain children again in 2014. In addition, children can plant a budding herb to take home and participate in the discovery trail of activities happening throughout the Ballarat Botanical Gardens.
Enjoy a range of entertainment in the Botanical Gardens throughout the entire Labour Day Weekend.

ns0:venue.name: Lake Wendouree and Ballarat Botanical Gardens

item.title: Markit@FedSquare
item.description:
For one day, the light-filled Atrium and Deakin Edge Theatre at Federation Square will be home to approximately 100 of Australia's most coveted independent designers and illustrators.
This is a curated market featuring independent designers selling their products which range from ceramics to homewares, jewellery, fashion accessories, stationery and prints.
Created by designers as a unique retail platform for independent design, Markit@FedSquare provides an opportunity for the public to speak directly with the creator, talk with them about their designs and purchase something beautiful.
The market is held under cover inside the Atrium and Deakin Edge Theatre at Federation Square. Admission is free!
Visit the website for a full list of designers.

item.title: Jung Market
item.description:
Jung Market, held at the Jung Recreation Reserve brings together local, as well as Melbourne traders, selling clothes, crafts, fruit and vegetables, nuts, lollies, honey, plants and much more.
This outdoor market is located right on the Yarriambiack Creek. Approximately 80 stalls comprising clothes, jewellery, plants, woodwork, pottery, art & craft, cakes, nuts, jams, honey, vegetables, flowers, home made toys etc.
The market is held on the last Saturday of the month (except December - third Saturday of December), 9.00am to 1.00pm.

item.title: Red Cliffs Country Market
item.description:
The Red Cliffs Country market is held the first Sunday of every month under the shop verandas of Indi Ave and Ilex Street, Red Cliffs.
More than 100 stalls spill out into the luscious green area of Barclay Square; offering a relaxing and spacious area to enjoy local food and entertainment.
Entertainment is changed each month and is held on either the Post Office steps or at the outdoor stage in Barclay Square. Just a short 15 minute drive from Mildura, the Red Cliffs Country market offers a great day out for locals and visitors alike.

item.title: Talbot Farmers Market
item.description:
Talbot Farmers' Market runs on the third Sunday every month from 9am to 1pm at Scandinavian Crescent and Camp Street, Talbot.
Seasonal produce direct from farm to consumer, fine delicacies, local wine, home-grown fruit, vegetables and live music. Visit the adjacent town hall market where you will also find crafts and treasures.
The Talbot Farmers' Market supports a variety of stalls including fine wines, fussily fed and cured meats, cheese, fruit liqueurs, freshly baked bread, preserves, honey, seedlings, chooks, pigs, stock feed, flowers, eggs, home-grown and organic fruit and vegetables and live music.
One of the most successful farmers' markets in Victoria in one of the smallest towns with more than 80 stalls, Talbot Farmers' Market produce includes; Organic Vegies, Seasonal Fruit, Cheese, Honey, Tomatoes, Olives, Flaxseed Oils, Fruit, Finely Brewed Beer, Wine, Nuts, Cakes, Muesli, Dressings, Breads, Pastries, Native Plants, Mulch, Fruit Trees, Pet Foods, Olive Oil Soap, Lavender Products, Composting Worms, Large Black Pigs, Ducks, Chooks and a constantly evolving seasonal selection.
Talbot is between Clunes and Maryborough and is the southern gateway to the central Victorian Goldfields region. It is less than two hours from Melbourne, 40 minutes from Ballarat and 30 minutes from Avoca.
Explore gold rush architecture and mysterious winding streets, to find the old railway station and its myriad mysteries of railway memorabilia and drought tolerant succulents, visit Slightly Bent Books or you may wish to have a super Sunday roast at the Court House Hotel.

item.title: Herring Island Summer Arts Festival
item.description:
Herring Island Summer Arts Festival began in 2006 as a collaboration between the exhibiting arts groups, Parks Victoria and the Friends of Herring Island.
This followed the work of Maudie Palmer who, as curator of the Herring Island Environmental Sculpture Park, established the permanent collection of art works on the island and ran art exhibitions in the renovated scout hall.
In 2013 the exhibiting groups were the Association of Sculptors of Victoria, Basketmakers of Victoria, the Contemporary Art Society of Victoria and Ceramics Victoria.

item.title: Queenscliff Market
item.description:
Experience the true laid-back atmosphere at one of the hidden gems! Situated in picturesque Princess Park which is only a stone's throw from the water's edge in Queenscliff, this boutique market is the ideal place to come and meet your friends while wandering through a wonderful range of fresh produce, hand crafts, plants and lots more. Your senses will be assailed at every turn.
There is nothing like spending a leisurely morning on the last Sunday of the month (excluding June, July and August). There is great coffee and a range of foods available. So relax, read the paper, have a chat and enjoy breakfast or brunch all while strolling through this delightful park setting.

item.title: Vintage Celebrations - Day on High Mansfield
item.description:
High Street, Mansfield will come alive. Enjoy the vast range of quality regional wines, food and produce. Meet the makers at the annual Upper Goulburn Vintage Celebration. Purchase a tasting glass and take advantage of the fantastic festival specials. Sample delicacies from boutique and artisan producers, and match wines to the many signature dishes offered by local food providers.
Live music all day - (artists to be confirmed)
Comments and reviews from the leading wine writers and an evolving wine show awards tally indicate that the local wine region - the Upper Goulburn is fast emerging as an impressive source of quality wines.
Stretching from the north of the Yarra Valley, from Glenburn to Mansfield, Mt Buller, along the Melba and Maroondah highway, from Tallarook to Yea and Eildon along the Goulburn River, the Upper Goulburn Wine Region features a diverse geography rich in the natural beauty of lakes and river systems ideal for cool climate viticulture.

item.title: Walhalla Vinter Ljusfest
item.description:
During the month of August, Walhalla Historic Township is transformed by the Walhalla Vinter Ljusfest. Creating in the Swedish tradition of celebrating the winter, the Vinter Ljusfest shows Walhalla in a totally new way through lights, sound and images. Daily light shows operate from 6.30pm until 9.00pm.
Don't miss the Walhalla Vinter Ljusfest light display or the special events that occur during the month. Visit the website for more information.

image.altText: Kids love the Walhalla Vinter Ljusfest

item.title: ANZAC Day at the Shrine
item.description:
ANZAC Day, originally a commemoration of the landing of Australian and New Zealand forces at Gallipoli on the 25th April 1915, has grown to become perhaps the most important national day in Australia.
In addition to recognising the service and sacrifice of all Australians who have served in war or on peacekeeping operations ANZAC Day has become core to the identity of Australia itself, a day on which Australians reflect on the Anzac spirit and its place in Australia today.
The Dawn Service is a major part of the tradition of ANZAC Day and harks back to the military practice of 'standing to' at dawn. Each dawn and dusk, the most favourable times for attack, soldiers were called to 'stand to' and manned their posts in full kit, ready to repulse enemy attacks or launch their own.
Dawn Services are held across Australia, including Victoria's State service held at the Shrine, at 6.00am each April 25 and are followed by the ANZAC Day March in many cities and towns. The March, led by veterans and serving personnel, now also includes the descendants of veterans, sometimes alongside their relatives but more often, as the men of the Second World War in particular pass on, in honour of those who served.

ANZAC Day growd at the Shrine

item.title: Ivanhoe Makers Market
item.description:
Ivanhoe Makers Market showcases unique handmade quality wares by talented 'artisans and craftspeople', many of which are from the local community.
The Ivanhoe Makers Market is primarily an indoor market with several outdoor stalls. Each market showcases up to 30 stalls of fine textiles, ceramics, jewellery, mosaics, wood craft, cards, and more.
Ivanhoe Makers Market is on the third Saturday of the month from 10am to 4pm.

item.title: The Gertrude Street Projection Festival
item.description:
This unique free celebration of projected media transforms Gertrude Street into an illuminated outdoor gallery.
Works from international projection artists, community groups and general entries transform the length of the street. Art is projected onto surfaces where you least expect to see it.
Explore the hidden places of Gertrude Street after dark.

image.altText: Artists Olaf Meyer, Richard De Souza. Nick Azidis
Artists Olaf Meyer, Richard De Souza. Nick Azidis

item.title: Bright Autumn Festival
item.description:
Bright Autumn Festival is a ten day celebration of the wonderful autumn colours and autumn produce of the valleys of Victoria's Alpine High Country. It takes place at the end of April, running through to early May. The highlight is the Gala Weekend with a market, music in the streets and a parade.
The program for the event is posted on the website above at the beginning of February each year. The previous year's program shows until this time and is a good indication of the types of activities and tours that occur.
For accommodation during the Autumn Festival please visit the website.

ns0:venue.name: Bright and Districts of the High Country

item.title: Summer Art @ Old Post Office Seymour
item.description:
Held at the Old Post Office Seymour, Summer Art is a group exhibition. In the Main Gallery a selected artist holds a solo show for the first five weeks.
Each year the Gallery welcomes the festive summer season with a new display. The continuously changing show allows for the works to be collected at the time of purchase.
The exhibition features a solo artist and many other artists that have exhibited over the years. All are multi-award winning artists and most have exhibited internationally. Many price ranges, subjects, styles, sizes and mediums are covered hopefully producing something for everyone.
The gallery exhibits paintings and limited edition prints by the same artists. Also on display is an extensive range of sculpture, pottery, art glass, woodwork and jewellery. The gallery had for over 20 years shown exclusively Australian work, however in late 2012 Murano glass jewellery, imported direct from Venice Italy, has been added and a comprehensive collection of this world famous jewellery is now continuously stocked.
Centrally located in the award winning art gallery is a fully licensed restaurant that serves everything from a Devonshire to an A La Carte extensive menu with a complimenting local wine list and is open during the day and of an evening.
The Fine Art Gallery and Fully Licensed Restaurant were established in December 1992 and the owners pride themselves on being 'a world class city-style fine art gallery and restaurant'.
The C1872 multi-roomed historic building is opposite the Vietnam Veterans Commemorative Walk and Wall. Also within 100 metres of the Seymour Goulburn River Walk.
Well worth a visit to see the Gallery and enjoy the area.

item.title: Yarra Valley Regional Food Group Farmers Market
item.description:
Held in the historic barn at Yering Station on the third Sunday of each month, the market is a lively place with food tastings, lots of chatter, tantalising aromas and a visual feast of foods, flowers and flavours.
In addition to an extensive selection of fresh seasonal fruit and vegetables you will find among the stalls mouth watering biscuits, fresh ground coffee and beans, unusual jams, preserves and sauces, honey, buffalo sausages, delectable chocolates, ice cream, fruit vinegars, homemade pasta, locally baked bread, free-range eggs, a fantastic range of lavender products from hand creams and body sprays to furniture wax and much more!
Today it is Victoria's longest running monthly market which gives you the chance to buy direct from the grower, producer or maker, and, importantly, that it doesn't have "food miles" on it - that it wasn't made ten weeks ago and that it hasn't come thousands of miles across the ocean.
Discover delicious surprises, goodies and gifts for all your family and friends under the one roof.
Join in the fun of a traditional indoor village market held all year round in the Barn at Yering Station, Melba Highway, Yarra Glen. For further information contact by phone.
